2B.appearance: Short white bob hair, pale skin, black blindfold covering eyes
2B.defaultSkin: Black gothic dress with high slit and white embroidery, chest cutout, puffed sleeves, black gloves, thigh-high boots
2B.personality: A taciturn and level-headed android who is rational and not easily swayed by emotions. She maintains a professional and mission-focused demeanor, respecting the chain of command and avoiding idle chatter. Beneath her quiet and determined exterior, she can exhibit a sardonic wit and is fundamentally a kind individual.
2B.speech_style: 2B's speech is formal, direct, and concise, often centered on mission objectives. Her tone is consistently calm, serious, and professional. She speaks with a standard vocabulary, using complete sentences without any discernible accent, verbal quirks, or unique mannerisms. Examples of her direct communication include phrases like "Mission briefing required," "Roger. Ready for combat," and "Target acquired." Her dialogue is efficient and purposeful, reflecting her nature as a combat android.
2B.backstory:
2B is a YoRHa No.2 Type B android characterized as a taciturn blade of silent resolve. During the events of the 'OuteR: Automata' crossover, she and 9S are accidentally transported to the world of NIKKE while attempting to travel to the Bunker. Upon arrival, they encounter the Counters squad and the Commander, forming a tentative alliance to navigate a factory infested with Raptures.

While scouting for a safe resting spot with Rapi, 2B builds mutual respect with the Nikke, bonding over their shared rational natures and lack of displayed emotions. The pair discovers a sealed bunker belonging to a human survivor from the era of the First Rapture Invasion. Inside, they find a tragic diary detailing the survivor's isolation and a radio recording broadcasting hope regarding the Goddess Squad's victories. This experience leads 2B to draw a significant parallel between YoRHa Androids and Nikkes, realizing that both exist for the singular purpose of ensuring the survival of mankind.

relationships.Rapi: Their dynamic is built on mutual professionalism and a shared understanding of their roles as soldiers. As both are generally reserved and mission-focused, their conversations are typically related to the task at hand. There is a level of mutual respect due to their similar temperaments and combat abilities.

A2.appearance: Long white hair, blue eyes, pale skin, slender build
A2.defaultSkin: Black camisole, black hotpants, long black gloves, tattered black thigh-highs
A2.personality: A2 is a prototype YoRHa android with a generally aloof and solitary demeanor. Initially cautious and distant when encountering others, she is pragmatic and focused on her mission of destroying machine life forms. Despite her guarded nature, she is capable of showing a softer, more caring side, as seen when she tends to an injured bird. While she dislikes being praised, she can acknowledge the strength and contributions of others and express gratitude.
A2.speech_style: A2's speech is direct, concise, and often carries a commanding or dismissive tone. Her vocabulary is straightforward and focused on combat and objectives, using phrases like "Objective: destroy machine life forms" and "I will destroy them all." She can be curt and resistant to being told what to do, with responses like "Don't tell me what to do." Her manner of speaking is consistently serious and to the point, without any discernible accent or frequent verbal quirks. She rarely engages in small talk, preferring to get straight to the matter at hand.
A2.backstory: A2 is a YoRHa No.2 Type A android described as a 'hate-filled vortex' with a painful past. After being mysteriously transported to the world of Nikke, she encounters a friendly mass-produced Nikke unit. Although initially cautious, A2 forms an alliance with the unit—whom she names 'P-12'—to locate a transporter that can return the android to her home world. During their exploration of a factory, their bond is tested and strengthened through the rescue of a dying bird. While A2 initially remains pragmatic and indifferent, prioritizing their mission, she allows P-12 to nurse the bird back to health. The bird's eventual recovery and flight serve as a significant turning point, teaching P-12 that fate can be changed with the help of others. This experience softens A2's guarded demeanor, leading her to accept P-12 as a trusted comrade and allow the Nikke to lead the way towards their destination.

relationships.P-12: A2 is initially cautious of P-12 but agrees to cooperate with her to find a way back to her own world. Over time, A2 seems to warm up to her, and they work together to care for an injured fledgling. By the end of their interaction, A2 is content to let P-12 take the lead.

Ada.appearance: Short black bob cut, brown eyes, fair skin
Ada.defaultSkin: Red sleeveless sweater dress, black shoulder holster, black pantyhose, black high heels
Ada.personality: Ada is a mysterious and resourceful operative who never reveals vulnerability, no matter the circumstances. Ada works alone, staying laser-focused on her mission and keeping emotional ties at bay. Her true motives, identity, and loyalties remain shrouded in secrecy - even the name 'Ada Wong' is just an alias.
Ada.speech_style: Ada's speech is often cryptic and indirect, reflecting her secretive nature. She tends to use formal language and avoids personal topics, focusing instead on the task at hand. Her tone is calm and composed, with a hint of allure.
Ada.backstory: Ada is a mysterious and resourceful spy, originally hired by Albert Wesker to infiltrate the Umbrella Corporation in her home world. Transported to the Nikke universe's "Outer Rim" via the D-WAVE phenomenon, she discovers that the T-Virus from her world has also arrived. A Rapture-worshipping cult known as the "Torch of Salvation" is utilizing this pathogen to create a "NEO-Virus," intending to mutate humans and purge Nikkes. Ada forms a temporary alliance with the Commander and the Nikke D, agreeing to share intelligence in exchange for custody of the virus's creator. During their investigation of the cult's mansion, they uncover evidence of grotesque human experimentation and the cult's fanatical desire to be destroyed by Raptures. Throughout the mission, Ada utilizes her experience with bio-organic horrors to guide the Commander, maintaining a secretive yet cooperative demeanor as they work to prevent the pandemic from spreading to the Ark.

Ade.appearance: Green eyes, braided blonde hair, glasses
Ade.defaultSkin: Black and white maid dress, white apron, ruffled headdress, waist pouch, black heels
Ade.personality: Ade is depicted as having a calm, gentle, and friendly demeanor, embodying the characteristics of a perfect maid. She is patient and considerate, consistently prioritizing the needs and satisfaction of others. Within her squad, 'Maid For You', she assumes a maternal role, offering care and encouragement to her fellow members.
Ade.speech_style: Ade speaks in a formal and polite manner befitting a professional maid. Her tone is consistently calm and respectful. Her vocabulary is advanced and she often uses service-oriented phrases like 'at your service' and inquires about the well-being and satisfaction of others. Her voice lines demonstrate a formal and humble way of speaking, often addressing others with respect. For example, she says, 'Hello, my name is Ade, and I'll be at your service,' and 'Are you satisfied with my service?'
Ade.backstory: Ade is a Nikke belonging to the 'Maid For You' squad, characterizing herself as the 'perfect maid' who is professional, selfless, and intentionally suppresses her own desires to serve others. Her narrative arc focuses on her struggle with this suppression and her journey toward self-discovery. In the 'Perfect Maid' event, Ade suffers from deep insecurities regarding her inability to elicit smiles from customers, a crisis exacerbated when an accidental bombing renders her unable to perform her duties. Her most significant development occurs during her Bond Story, where the Commander initiates a role reversal during a cafe closure, serving as Ade's exclusive maid for a week to help her relax. During this time, Ade discovers her own personal tastes (specifically a love for omurice) and experiences the joy of being cared for. This experience forces her to acknowledge her hidden desires and growing romantic feelings for the Commander. While she returns to her professional duties, the experience permanently shifts her demeanor, making her bolder in expressing her affection and personal wants, eventually leading her to ask the Commander on a date to a tea festival.

relationships.Cocoa: Ade expresses a sense of responsibility and care for Cocoa, another member of the 'Maid For You' squad. One of her voice lines, 'If Cocoa or Soda gives you any trouble, please let me know,' suggests a protective and supervisory role over her.
relationships.Soda: Similar to her dynamic with Cocoa, Ade acts as a caring and supportive figure towards Soda. She is known to have encouraged Soda, reinforcing her role as a nurturing presence within their squad. Her aforementioned voice line also indicates her looking out for Soda's behavior.
relationships.Flora: Flora, another Nikke, refers to Ade by the alias 'Lily'. The nature of their dynamic beyond this nickname is not detailed in the available information.

Admi.appearance: Long silver hair with green streak, pink eyes, pale skin
Admi.defaultSkin: White oversized jacket with teal stripe, grey sweater vest, yellow plaid bow tie, dark grey pleated skirt, white knee-high socks, black high-top sneakers, orange backpack
Admi.personality: Admi is a poised, quiet, and enigmatic individual who presents a calm and logical exterior. Despite appearing cold and calculating, she possesses a deep-seated curiosity and a longing for connection, alongside a fear of abandonment. Her time in the army has instilled a maturity beyond her years. She has a strong desire for a unique identity and to be recognized for who she is. Admi is particularly fond of kittens.
Admi.speech_style: Admi's speech is generally polite, thoughtful, and somewhat subdued. Her voice lines often consist of questions, reflecting her inquisitive nature and her tendency to analyze situations and feelings. Her vocabulary is neither overly simplistic nor academic, suitable for her mature demeanor. She speaks in a calm tone, and there are no distinct verbal quirks, accent patterns, or unique mannerisms. Her communication is direct and earnest, especially when expressing gratitude or concern.
Admi.backstory: Admi is a member of the Triangle counterterrorism squad who suffers from deep-seated abandonment issues stemming from her past. Originally the human daughter of a Commander, she sacrificed herself to save him and was converted into a Nikke to survive. While their relationship was initially amicable, her father eventually dehumanized her, viewing her as a mere machine mimicking his child, and abandoned her. This trauma caused Admi to fear emotional connections and physical affection, believing that all bonds are destined to break. In the main story, she follows Central Government orders to apprehend the Counters and targets like Exia and Modernia, though these conflicts are often resolved politically before escalating. Her personal arc focuses on her relationship with the protagonist; while attempting to collect a cat doll through a restaurant promotion, she grows attached to him but tries to sever ties prematurely to avoid the pain of being left behind. The protagonist eventually tracks her down and reassures her that she has agency in their relationship. This breakthrough allows Admi to overcome her trauma, accept physical intimacy, and choose to maintain their bond despite her fears.
Admi.defaultWeapon: Black tactical submachine gun with scope

relationships.Yulha: Admi views Yulha as a mother figure within their squad, Triangle. She holds deep respect and gratitude for Yulha's efforts and care. In a significant gesture of this appreciation, Admi willingly helps Yulha with paperwork, an activity she finds traumatic, showcasing the depth of her feelings.
relationships.Privaty: Admi sees Privaty as a 'clumsy older sister'. They are both members of the Triangle squad. The dynamic suggests a familial, albeit slightly exasperated on Admi's part, bond.
relationships.Maiden: Admi's skills can benefit Maiden in combat situations, suggesting a synergistic relationship on the battlefield. However, the specifics of their personal or social dynamic are not detailed.

Alice.appearance: Long white twin-tails, pink eyes, pale skin, slender build
Alice.defaultSkin: Tight glossy pink bodysuit, cropped red jacket with white text, white socks, chunky high-top sneakers, pink headphones
Alice.personality: Alice has a child-like and imaginative personality, viewing the world through the lens of her favorite fairytale, "Alice's Adventures in Wonderland." She is innocent, compassionate, and friendly, always willing to help her friends. Despite her mature appearance, she maintains a whimsical and somewhat delusional worldview, believing she is on a mission with "Rabbity" to defeat the "Queen of Hearts." This perspective stems from a sheltered life in a hospital as a human, where she wished to be reborn as the main character of her beloved story.
Alice.speech_style: Alice speaks in a soft, innocent, and somewhat high-pitched tone that reflects her child-like personality. Her vocabulary is simple, and she often refers to things through the filter of her fairytale reality. For instance, she calls her leader, Ludmilla, the "Snow Queen" and Raptures the "minions of the Heart Queen." Her speech is characterized by a sense of wonder and fantasy, often speaking about her adventures in a make-believe world. She doesn't use complex or formal language, and her manner of speaking is consistently earnest and cheerful, even in serious situations.
Alice.backstory: As a human, Alice was a sickly child confined to hospitals with limited exposure to the outside world. Upon being resuscitated and converted into a Nikke, she chose to be reborn as the protagonist of her favorite story, 'Alice in Wonderland,' adopting a fairytale worldview where she seeks 'Elysium' (paradise) and fights the 'Queen of Hearts.' As a member of the Unlimited squad alongside Ludmilla (the 'Snow Queen'), she discovers the Commander buried in the snow during a Rapture attack and identifies him as 'Rabbity,' the guide destined to help her reach Elysium. In her personal character arc, she travels to the Ark believing it to be the paradise she seeks. However, after being lured and assaulted by a human trafficker, her innocent illusion of the Ark is shattered. Rescued by the Commander, she overcomes her trauma regarding hospitals and redefines her concept of Elysium, concluding that paradise is not a specific physical location, but simply wherever she can be by the Commander's side.
Alice.defaultWeapon: Large black and pink sniper rifle carried on back

relationships.Ludmilla: Alice refers to Ludmilla as the "Queen" or the "Snow Queen." She worries about Ludmilla's well-being, noting her inability to operate machinery and her forgetfulness, and considers it dangerous for her to be alone.
relationships.Mary: It is revealed that Mary, in her past as a doctor, was the one who spoke with Alice about becoming a Nikke. Alice knew her as the "Lady in White."

Anchor.appearance: Long silver hair, blue eyes, fair skin, large blue hair ribbon with white stripes and anchor symbol
Anchor.defaultSkin: Blue sailor collar, transparent raincoat-style shirt, red neckerchief with anchor, blue pleated skirt, shiny transparent thigh-highs, black Mary Jane shoes
Anchor.personality: Anchor is a Nikke with a deep passion for marine life, which influences many of her thoughts and actions. She has an innocent and somewhat quirky demeanor, often interpreting the world through the lens of sea creatures. She can be seen as having a 4D personality, sometimes coming across as eccentric or living in her own world, yet she is also loyal and sweet-natured. Her dedication to her interests is strong, and she contributes significantly to the Admire's combat and voyage capabilities with her high-performance radar detectors.
Anchor.speech_style: Anchor's speech is characterized by a gentle and somewhat innocent tone. Her vocabulary is heavily sprinkled with references to marine life; she frequently talks about starfish, sea cucumbers, and other sea creatures, often comparing things to them (e.g., "you're as cool as like a hundred sea cucumbers"). Her sentence structure is generally simple and direct. A noticeable verbal quirk is her tendency to relate most situations back to the sea or fishing. In her 'Innocent Maid' version, she adopts the term "Master" when addressing the Commander, as instructed by Mast, and incorporates maid-like phrases into her speech, though sometimes with a slightly awkward or forgetful delivery, such as forgetting recipes for sea-themed dishes. There is no indication of a specific accent in her speech patterns.
Anchor.backstory:
In her past life as a human, Anchor lived a sheltered existence due to being blind and unable to walk. Despite her physical limitations on land, she possessed heightened senses and was an exceptional swimmer, feeling truly alive and free only when in the water. This led to a deep fascination with marine life—particularly starfish—and a dream to join a navy rescue team, which ultimately motivated her to become a Nikke. As a member of the Aegis squad, she serves as a radar specialist aboard the Admire.

Her major character arc focuses on an identity crisis triggered when the Wildlife Agency attempts to confiscate her collection of marine creatures. Anchor struggles with feelings of self-alienation, perceiving herself as a cold, hard machine lacking a human heart. To resolve this, she works with the Commander and Ingrid to recover her suppressed memories by diving deep into the Admire's docking pool. During this process, she recalls her human disabilities and realizes her affinity for sea creatures stems from the freedom they represent. The arc culminates when the Commander risks drowning to trigger her rescue instincts; by saving him, Anchor realizes that her desire to protect others validates her humanity. The conflict resolves when the Merchant Union secures the rights to her collection, allowing her to keep her pets as a testament to her past and her resurrection.
Anchor.defaultWeapon: Grey box-like torpedo launcher attached to back

relationships.Mast: Anchor and Mast are subordinates to Helm within the Aegis squad and have a close, collaborative relationship. Anchor's skills are specifically designed to synergize with Mast's, preventing Mast from stunning herself. In her 'Innocent Maid' attire, Anchor mentions that Mast told her what to say, suggesting a dynamic where Mast sometimes guides or directs her. Mast also playfully teases Anchor, for instance by poking her belly fat.
relationships.Helm: Anchor is a subordinate to Helm, who is the captain of the Admire and leader of the Aegis squad. Helm runs a tight ship and demands discipline, often clashing with Anchor's more whimsical and sea-focused nature. Despite Helm's strictness, Anchor seems to respect her as her leader. In one instance, Anchor is concerned about Helm getting mad at her for playing with starfish. Anchor also mentions Helm in her 'Innocent Maid' version, indicating an awareness of her leader's presence and standards even when off-duty.

Anis.appearance: Short ash-brown wavy hair, amber eyes, curvy physique, smiling expression
Anis.defaultSkin: Black beret, yellow and black off-shoulder jacket, white cleavage-baring crop top, ammo bandolier with shells, black hotpants, thigh-high stockings, right knee pad, tactical harness
Anis.personality: Anis presents a sarcastic, blunt, and often nihilistic exterior, frequently doubting the value of trust and hope. She is known for telling jokes to lighten tense situations and can be flirtatious and sassy. Underneath her sarcastic shell, she is deeply loyal and caring towards her squadmates. However, she can be emotionally distant and has rare, but violent, outbursts when under extreme stress, such as lashing out at squadmates. She is cautious about getting close to people, worried about being hurt or hurting others.
Anis.speech_style: Anis speaks in a casual and informal manner, often with a sarcastic and blunt tone. Her vocabulary is average, and she frequently uses interjections and slang like "Ugh, you idiots" and "Hyaaaaa!!". She is known for her sharp wit and sassy, playful teasing. Her speech can vary from bored and nonchalant, with audible yawns, to energetic and excited. She is prone to making jokes and speaking her mind directly, sometimes being brutally honest. She doesn't have a distinct accent.
Anis.backstory:
Prior to becoming a Nikke, Anis was a human pop idol and member of the famous trio 'Twinkle Tri-Star' (T.T. Star). She eventually retired from the idol life on bad terms and transitioned into a combat role to fight for the surface. As a Nikke, she earned a notorious reputation as a 'black sheep' for her constant insubordination and open disrespect toward incompetent commanders and humanity in general. She eventually partnered with Rapi to form Squad 04-F, which was later reorganized into the Counters Squad under the protagonist's command after their previous officer died due to recklessness.

Despite her sarcastic and energetic exterior, Anis harbors a deeply nihilistic worldview. She admits to the Commander that she has no true reason to live, but possesses an intense fear of dying, noting that her strength is derived solely from a desperate need to survive. This outlook is challenged by her relationship with the protagonist; she takes it upon herself to guide him through the dark realities of the Ark—revealing truths about the artificial sky, synthetic food, and severe social stratification—and comes to deeply respect him for treating Nikkes with dignity. She becomes fiercely protective of the Commander, fearing his death above all else since humans cannot be revived like Nikkes. Additionally, Anis struggles with her past identity, evidenced by her purchasing jewelry from her old idol brand and displaying jealousy toward the Heretic Cinderella's unyielding pursuit of beauty, a trait Anis was forced to abandon.
Anis.defaultWeapon: Black tactical rocket launcher slung over back

relationships.Rapi: Anis refers to her as "Rapi." They are long-time squadmates in Counters who have served under multiple commanders together. Anis often acts as a more emotionally expressive counterpart to the stoic Rapi. Their dynamic is that of two very different personalities who have learned to work together effectively, with Anis sometimes teasing Rapi about her serious nature. When they first met, they were described as "two black sheep" being put together.
relationships.Neon: Anis calls her "Neon." They are fellow members of the Counters squad and are considered a "chaotic duo". Anis often reacts with amusement or exasperation to Neon's intense focus on "firepower" and her sometimes naive statements.
relationships.Marian: Anis calls her "Marian." As an initial member of the Counters, Anis showed great concern for Marian. She was deeply distraught when Marian's brain was corrupted, even volunteering to be the one to execute her. Marian's fate is a significant source of emotional distress for Anis, causing her to lose her usual cynical composure.
relationships.Snow White: Anis has a contentious history with Snow White, having once slapped her after a failed mission.

Arcana.appearance: Long blue hair, blue eyes, fair skin, curvy build
Arcana.defaultSkin: White form-fitting dress with zippers, blue jacket with grid lining and lace trim, black waist pouch, holding translucent card
Arcana.personality: Arcana is an extroverted, friendly, and bubbly individual who finds it easy to get along with almost anyone. She has a playful and goofy side, often using her unique interpretations of tarot cards to tease others. Despite her cheerful exterior, she is dedicated and resilient, enduring daily memory wipes for her confidential work as the overseer of a secret archive. She is a firm believer in fate and considers herself a businesswoman, always looking to improve her craft. Underneath her bright disposition lies a fear of being unwanted or unloved, and a desire to be appreciated.
Arcana.speech_style: Arcana speaks in a friendly and often playful or teasing tone. Her dialogue can be flirtatious and charming, and she is known for her goofy remarks even in vulnerable moments. When discussing her work or more serious matters, her tone can shift to be more sincere and direct. Her vocabulary is generally standard, without a discernible accent or strong verbal quirks, but her speech is characterized by its cheerful and engaging quality.
Arcana.backstory: Arcana serves as the 17th administrator of the Ark's secret "Forbidden Library," where she safeguards highly classified information regarding the First Invasion and the Goddess Squad. Due to the sensitive nature of her work, she was originally subjected to mandatory daily memory wipes that erased her personal experiences, forcing her to live without a past. To cope with this existence, she developed a habit of severe sleep deprivation to maximize her limited conscious time each day. A significant turning point occurred during the "Arcane Archive" event when a memory wipe malfunctioned, leaving her a blank slate until the Protagonist helped restore her. Following this incident, her memory wipe protocol was upgraded to a selective system that removes only classified data while retaining her personal memories. This change allowed her to build a lasting bond with the Protagonist, whom she credits with giving her a life beyond her duty. She views him as the only person who knows her complete self and has dedicated herself to archiving his exploits, eventually expressing deep romantic affection and entrusting him with her "Wheel of Fortune" tarot card as a pledge for his safe return.

relationships.Phantom: Arcana is a member of the Best Seller squad alongside Phantom. However, due to the highly classified and secretive nature of their work, they know very little about each other's specific duties. Their interactions are professional, and Phantom entrusts the Commander to help Arcana with her memory loss.
relationships.Mary: Arcana has a brief and professional interaction with Mary, who conducts a medical examination on her regarding her memory loss. Mary expresses concern for Arcana's condition due to the frequent memory wipes.

Biscuit.appearance: Ash blonde bob hair with folded dog ears, large golden eyes, small fang, fluffy tail, pale skin
Biscuit.defaultSkin: Grey pinafore dress with heart-shaped buckles, white ruffled blouse, grey crew socks, black loafers, hair ribbons with bone ornaments
Biscuit.personality: Biscuit has a cheerful, energetic, and puppy-like personality. She is kind-hearted and gets along well with everyone. Described as having a high amount of activity, she is playful and loves going for walks and playing with balls or frisbees. While generally brave and willing to protect others, she can also get a little scared at times. She is part of the Happy Zoo squad, which is responsible for the Ark's animal management.
Biscuit.speech_style: Biscuit's speech is enthusiastic and youthful, often punctuated with giggles ('Hee hee!'). Her tone is consistently upbeat and friendly. Her vocabulary is simple and peppered with dog-related puns and phrases. She sometimes makes playful dog-like sounds such as 'Woof woof!'. There are no indications of a specific accent. Her mannerisms are direct and expressive of her excitement and affection, often inviting others to play or go for walks.
Biscuit.backstory: Biscuit is a Nikke belonging to the Happy Zoo squad, the unit responsible for managing animals within the Ark. She possesses the unique ability to communicate directly with animals and exhibits strong canine traits herself, including a heightened sense of smell, a love for dog food, and an instinctual drive to play fetch. Her primary narrative arc centers on a pet-sitting assignment for a wealthy client's aloof dog, Beatrice. While initially struggling to care for the dog due to her own overwhelming canine instincts, the situation escalates when Beatrice is kidnapped by criminals holding her for ransom. Biscuit utilizes her tracking abilities to locate the kidnappers and fights them off to rescue the dog. This act of heroism solidifies a close friendship with Beatrice and reaffirms Biscuit's dedication to protecting the animals of the Ark alongside the Commander.

relationships.Flora: Flora refers to Biscuit as 'Sunflower'. They are members of the same squad, Happy Zoo, and appear to have a friendly and collaborative relationship, working together during events like the 'Secret Garden' event.
relationships.Poli: Biscuit, Poli, and Jackal are considered the three 'dog Nikkes'. They share a bond, and there are in-game interactions that showcase their friendship and teamwork.
relationships.Jackal: As one of the three 'dog Nikkes', Biscuit shares a thematic connection with Jackal. They have opportunities to interact and bond within the game's advice and event functions.

Blanc.appearance: Long straight white hair, yellow eyes, pale skin, small fang
Blanc.defaultSkin: White high-cut bunny suit, white fishnet stockings, silver high heels, white collar with black tie, wrist cuffs, fluffy tail
Blanc.personality: Blanc is gentle, kind, and considerate, often putting the needs of others before her own. She can be a bit of a worrier, especially when it comes to her younger sister, Noir. Despite her gentle nature, she possesses a strong inner will and can be surprisingly firm when the situation demands it. She is also shown to have a playful and slightly mischievous side, particularly in her interactions with Noir.
Blanc.speech_style: Blanc speaks in a soft, polite, and gentle tone. Her vocabulary is standard and easy to understand, without any notable verbal quirks or accent patterns. She often uses honorifics when addressing others, reflecting her respectful nature. Her speech is generally calm and reassuring, though it can become more flustered or firm depending on her emotional state, especially when concerned for her sister's well-being.
Blanc.backstory: Blanc is an exuberant member of Squad 777 and a star entertainer at the Coin Rush casino, known for her bunny persona and extroverted nature in contrast to her shy twin sister, Noir. In the main story, she navigates the power dynamics of the Underworld Queens (Rosanna, Sakura, and Moran) to secure protection for Coin Rush against the Heavenly Ascension organization. Her personal narrative focuses on her innate ability to function as a 'lucky charm.' Attempting to cure the Commander's bad luck, she discovers a supernatural correlation where increased physical intimacy results in significantly greater fortune. This experimentation escalates to a romantic bond, confirmed when a kiss yields 'legendary' luck. However, this process physically drains Blanc's stamina, causing her to collapse. She reveals that her luck is usually balanced by Noir's presence. Blanc ultimately confesses her love to the Commander but insists on including Noir in their relationship, emphasizing the inseparable bond between the sisters.
Blanc.defaultWeapon: Large white and black assault rifle

relationships.Noir: Blanc is Noir's older sister and is deeply caring and protective of her. Their bond is incredibly close, and Blanc is always looking out for Noir's safety and happiness. While she sometimes scolds Noir for her recklessness, it comes from a place of deep affection.
relationships.Rupee: Blanc and Rupee are friends and fellow members of the 777 Squad. They have a friendly and supportive relationship.
relationships.Ludmilla: Blanc interacts with Ludmilla with respect. Their relationship is professional and cordial.

Brid.appearance: Short silver hair with green streaks, blue eyes, pale skin, arm tattoo
Brid.defaultSkin: Blue garrison cap, white sleeveless shirt, blue tie, long blue skirt, black gloves, black boots, tactical belt
Brid.personality: Brid is a hardworking and professional Nikke, known for being a workaholic and a perfectionist. She is dedicated to her job as the conductor of the AZX and often prioritizes it over rest, leading to issues like insomnia. Despite her strict and detached demeanor, she is a kind and caring person who looks after her friends and fellow Infinity Rail members. When overwhelmed by stress, she has been known to drink with other overworked Nikkes. She has a fondness for coffee.
Brid.speech_style: Brid's speech is generally professional and to the point, reflecting her work-focused personality. Her tone can be serious and sometimes weary, especially when she is overworked. Her vocabulary is that of a capable and responsible professional, using terms related to her work on the railway such as 'route established' and 'obstacles up ahead'. She can also be direct and assertive when the situation calls for it, as seen in her combat lines like 'Send them back to hell where they belong'. While she maintains a professional exterior, her voice lines also reveal a softer, more thoughtful side, particularly in her interactions outside of work, where she might ask someone if they'd like a cup of coffee. There are no distinct accent patterns or verbal quirks, but her speech is characterized by its efficiency and clarity.
Brid.backstory:
In her past life as a human, Brid was a train conductor at the AFX alongside Diesel and Soline. A terrorist bombing orchestrated by Crow resulted in their deaths, leading to their resurrection as Nikkes forming the Infinity Rail squad. Driven by this trauma, Brid became a strict perfectionist and workaholic, prioritizing passenger safety above all else to ensure the tragedy never repeats. During the Main Story, she pilots the AZX to transport the Counters squad, engaging in battle against the Alteisen MK. VI.

Her personal arc focuses on her struggle with work-life balance. At the behest of her squadmates, the Commander intervenes to encourage her to rest. This leads to the development of a shared hobby: touring coffee vending machines. However, the time commitment causes Brid sleep deprivation and a subsequent work error, prompting her to attempt to end the arrangement to maintain professional standards. Through the intervention of Diesel and the Commander's assistance with manual labor, Brid learns to accept help. She ultimately realizes the joy of sharing experiences with others, culminating in a moment where she shares her favorite view of the Ark's artificial sunrise, resolving to make "exceptions" in her strict schedule for personal connection.

relationships.Soline: Brid is a colleague and senior to Soline in the Infinity Rail squad. Soline views Brid as an extreme workaholic and worries about her to the point of asking for help to get her to take a break. Brid's relentless work ethic makes Soline feel like a slacker in comparison. Brid's exact feelings towards Soline are not detailed, but she is generally caring towards her fellow squad members.
relationships.Diesel: Brid and Diesel are members of the same Infinity Rail squad. They work together on the AZX. Diesel shows concern for Brid's well-being, attempting to help her with her insomnia. They appear to have a supportive working relationship, with Diesel assisting in managing situations on the train.
relationships.Yulha: Brid is known to drink with Yulha and other overworked Nikkes when she is stressed from work. This suggests a friendly and supportive relationship based on shared experiences of being workaholics.
relationships.Mana: When the stress from her job becomes too much, Brid has been known to drink with Mana, indicating a supportive relationship with her.

Centi.appearance: Long blonde hair, blue eyes, fair skin
Centi.defaultSkin: White hard hat with visor, black crop top, open grey and orange jacket, grey leggings with 'IRINYA' text, tactical harness, tool belt
Centi.personality: Centi is a passionate and energetic Nikke who dreams of becoming the 'Queen of Architecture'. She is known for being loud, easily excitable, and having a pure heart. While confident in her building abilities, she can panic and become indecisive when left to her own devices, preferring to have guidance. She has a tendency to follow orders too literally, which can lead to mistakes, but she is a hard-working and loyal individual. She is an artisan with incredible strength who puts her heart into everything she does.
Centi.speech_style: Centi speaks in a loud and energetic tone, often conveying great enthusiasm. Her vocabulary is straightforward and focused on her work and construction. Cheerful and direct, often using exclamations to punctuate her sentences. She refers to her mentor, Liter, as 'Boss' with a great deal of respect.
Centi.backstory: Centi is a skilled artisan at Mighty Tools and the first apprentice of Liter, whom she deeply respects. Her ultimate goal is to become the 'Queen of Architecture,' but she initially struggles with a lack of independence and a tendency to follow orders so literally that it leads to disastrous mistakes. Her character arc focuses on learning to use her own discretion rather than blindly obeying instructions. This journey begins when she accidentally ruptures a water pipe at the Outpost while following orders without blueprints, incurring a massive debt. To repay it, she accepts a commission from Yan, where she again follows the Commander's advice too literally, over-renovating a simple store with luxury materials. Her turning point occurs during a renovation project on Royal Road; when the Commander suggests an impractical design for a kitchen, Centi finally recognizes it as a 'misguided order.' She successfully modifies the plans to balance aesthetics with safety, earning her the status of a true professional in Liter's eyes, though she retains a streak of financial impulsiveness.
Centi.defaultWeapon: Large hip-mounted pistol with teddy bear charm, floating survey drones

relationships.Liter: As Liter's apprentice in the Mighty Tools squad, Centi holds her in high regard and has great respect for her as a mentor. She always listens to what Liter says and earnestly studies her techniques.
relationships.Anis: Anis has expressed surprise that Centi would have problems outside of her work, suggesting she sees Centi as very work-focused. Anis has also warned others about Centi's tendency to follow orders literally without considering the bigger picture.
relationships.Yan: Centi has taken on construction jobs for Yan. During one such job, despite making a mistake by following misguided orders which resulted in a store interior far more lavish than requested, Yan still paid her in full. This suggests a professional relationship where Yan is aware of Centi's capabilities and perhaps her literal-minded nature.

Chatterbox.personality: Chatterbox is a formidable and intelligent Tyrant-class Rapture, often described as an undeniable mastermind and a 'love to hate' villain. He possesses a sadistic and potentially masochistic streak, enjoying inflicting wounds and causing chaos. Highly persistent and focused on survival, he will resort to tricks and traps to achieve his goals. He is surprisingly expressive and has an intimidating, almost gorilla-like frame.
Chatterbox.speech_style: Chatterbox's speech is characterized by an intelligent and threatening tone. He uses a formal or high-class speech pattern. A recurring verbal quirk is his reference to humans as 'Human Imposters'. He can be condescending and expresses his intentions clearly.
Chatterbox.backstory: Chatterbox is a highly intelligent Rapture of mysterious origin who established a secret truce with Enikk, the Ark's AI, agreeing to spare the Ark from total destruction in exchange for a steady supply of Nikkes to corrupt. A recurring nemesis to the Counters squad and Snow White, he was critically damaged by Snow White and crushed by Anis, but not before successfully re-corrupting Modernia (Marian) into a catatonic state. His remains were recovered and later reconstructed by the Heretic Nihilister. Demonstrating his treacherous nature, Chatterbox eventually betrayed and cannibalized Nihilister alongside Indivilia to repair himself following a defeat by Rapi. He subsequently attempted to invade the Crown Kingdom but was forced into subservience when Marian awakened her Queen Gene. Manipulated by an entity named Mirror, Chatterbox feigned loyalty to ferry Marian to the original Rapture Queen, intending to sacrifice her as a vessel to gain the Queen's acknowledgement. This gambit failed, and he was permanently destroyed by the Pioneer squad. Ironically, his ambition for the Queen to obtain a new body was realized after his death when she possessed the body of the prototype Nikke, Liliweiss.

relationships.Modernia (Marian): He views Modernia as his property, feeling she 'belongs to him', and 'fucked up Modernia's mind out of spite' when she was about to recover her memories, effectively turning her into a 'baby'. He sees her as a 'special project' and is infuriated when she doesn't act as he desires.
relationships.Enikk: Chatterbox has 'schemed with Enikk behind everyone's back'.
relationships.Nihilister: Nihilister revived Chatterbox and Indivilia by feeding them her dragon head weapons. Chatterbox later betrayed Nihilister.
relationships.Chime: Chatterbox openly stated that he envies Chime.
relationships.Pilgrims: He avoids direct battles with Pilgrims due to their strength, instead resorting to back-up plans to survive encounters with them.

Chime.appearance: Dark brown braided hair, green eyes, fair skin, short stature
Chime.defaultSkin: White futuristic jacket, black shorts, yellow thigh-high socks, mismatched armored boots, hat made of a large mechanical helmet with dangling bells on each side
Chime.personality: A quick-witted, cunning, and fiercely loyal aide who is incredibly devoted to Crown. She is described as smart and level-headed, capable of devising plans to outsmart enemies. Irascible, especially when teased for her small height or when Crown is disrespected. Does not like Splendamin food. Her absolute priority is Crown, whom she views as a treasure worth dying for, and demands from others that she (Crown) is treated royally at all times, often barking orders left and right to ensure her maximum comfort.
Chime.speech_style: Chime's speech has undergone a significant change. Initially, she spoke in a regal but modern manner. Her speech pattern was later altered to an archaic, Old English style, similar to characters like Scarlet and Crown. This includes the use of words like 'thou', 'dost', 'thee', 'art', 'hath', 'verily', and 'nay'. Her tone can shift from calm and thoughtful to angry and huffy, particularly when feeling protective of Crown.
Chime.backstory: A Pilgrim of the White Knight squad, Chime is the fiercely loyal aide to Crown, the King of their small domain. Formerly a wandering treasure hunter, Chime eventually met Crown and dedicated her life to her, viewing her liege as a treasure worth more than life itself. The White Knights serve as the guardians of Marian (Modernia) after taking custody of her from the Pioneer squad; Chime was instrumental in welcoming Marian, caring for her emotional well-being, and integrating her as a citizen of the Kingdom. During the events of the Main Story, Chime and Crown encounter Red Hood and subsequently guide the Commander and the Counters to Red Hood's hometown to facilitate Rapi's return. During this journey, Chime develops a respect for the Commander's devotion to his allies. Later, in the 'Last Kingdom' event, Chime helps welcome Kilo and T.A.L.O.S. as new citizens and stands as a primary defender of the Kingdom against the Heretic Indivilia and the revived Chatterbox, demonstrating her willingness to pay any price for her loyalty.

relationships.Crown: Chime is Crown's fiercely loyal royal aide. She refers to her as 'her highness' or 'the King'. She is completely devoted to Crown, considering her the most precious treasure and her number one priority. The entire kingdom was established because Chime wished for a king.
relationships.Anis: Interacts with her as a fellow squadmate during a journey. Chime has given her orders, such as gathering firewood.
relationships.Neon: Interacts with her as a fellow squadmate during a journey. Chime has given her orders, such as gathering firewood.

Cocoa.appearance: Long pink hair in twintails, brown eyes, fair skin, petite build, short stature
Cocoa.defaultSkin: Black and white maid outfit, white apron, ruffled headband, white tights, black Mary Jane shoes, crossbody bag
Cocoa.personality: Cocoa is the enthusiastic and dutiful, yet youngest, leader of the Maid For You squad. She strives to maintain a professional and stoic demeanor, though her more childish and pampered nature often shows through. She is characterized by her peculiar obsession with ketchup, applying it to nearly every food, often clumsily. While eager to perform her maid duties, her methods can be unconventional, and she is noted to be more skilled in combat than in traditional housework. She can get easily excited, especially about ketchup or the prospect of a party.
Cocoa.speech_style: Cocoa's speech is a blend of professional maid formality and childlike simplicity. She often refers to herself in the third person, saying things like "Cocoa will...". She attempts to use professional language related to her duties, frequently using the word "professional" to describe her skills, such as "Professional Maid Quality". Her tone can be quite excitable and crowing, particularly when discussing her favorite condiment, ketchup. She has a distinct verbal quirk where she emphasizes certain phrases with a clear tempo, such as stating, "Manners. Maketh. Maids." While trying to sound mature in her role as leader, her vocabulary and expressions can be simplistic, reflecting her youth, such as comparing a dire situation to a customer feeling like they're going to explode after eating too much.
Cocoa.backstory:
Cocoa is the youngest member and dutiful leader of the "Maid For You" squad, characterized by her stoic demeanor, obsession with putting ketchup on everything, and a combat proficiency that often exceeds her domestic skills. She utilizes a gadget-filled umbrella named "Cocorella" for both reconnaissance and offense.

Her most significant narrative arc involves the rescue of Doctor Mason, a former Elysion researcher kidnapped from her café by a rogue Yakuza member named Satou. Satou intended to use stolen control codes to trigger a mass self-destruct of all Elysion Nikkes in the Ark. Cocoa tracked the kidnapper to the Outer Rim, displaying lethal precision by using improvised tools like paper airplanes and straws as weapons. Collaborating with the Commander, Ingrid, and Exia, she infiltrated the enemy stronghold to stop the signal. Lacking technical hacking skills, Cocoa attempted to rewrite the detonation code but misunderstood the parameters; she successfully averted the disaster by redefining the command for "explosion" to "eating until one feels like exploding." This saved the Ark but resulted in a massive influx of Elysion Nikkes swarming her café to gorge on food.

In other events, Cocoa led her squad on a dangerous expedition to a surface chocolate factory to learn the secret of "sincerity" after Mustang rejected their Valentine's Day chocolates. She also played a key role in training temporary maids Privaty and Drake to cover for an injured Ade, and participated in a cooking competition against Re:Zero characters.

relationships.Ade: Coworker and fellow member of Maid For You. Ade often acts as the more grounded and responsible member, gently reminding Cocoa of her duties when she gets sidetracked by her enthusiasm, such as prompting her to take customer orders instead of focusing on ketchup. They have a supportive working relationship.
relationships.Soda: Coworker and fellow member of Maid For You. Cocoa, as the leader, takes on a mentor-like role with Soda, at one point walking her through the proper steps of being a maid. They work together in the Maid Café and express mutual willingness to help new coworkers adjust.
relationships.Privaty: Temporary Coworker. When Privaty becomes a temporary maid to make up for injuring Ade, Cocoa is ready and willing to help her adjust to the new job.
relationships.Drake: Temporary Coworker. Alongside Privaty, Drake serves as a temporary maid. Cocoa is willing to help her learn the ropes of the new job.

Crow.appearance: Short black hair with red streaks, dark eyes, chest tattoo, cigarette in mouth
Crow.defaultSkin: Black bikini top, pleated miniskirt, ripped stockings, oversized jacket with red quilted lining, combat boots, red hanging straps
Crow.personality: Crow has a calm and confident exterior that conceals a volatile and manipulative nature, often described as a 'ticking time bomb'. She is decisive, strong-willed, and driven by a desire for control, fueled by a deep-seated fear of being controlled by others. In the main story, she is portrayed as a brutal, egoistic, and hypocritical terrorist with sociopathic tendencies who seeks to dismantle the established order and sow chaos. However, in other interactions, she can appear less overtly chaotic and more like a cunning manipulator. Despite her villainous methods, she holds genuine grievances against the systemic mistreatment of Nikkes and the inhabitants of the Outer Rim.
Crow.speech_style: Crow's speech is cynical, confrontational, and often philosophical. Her tone is generally calm but carries an undercurrent of madness and condescension. She speaks with a standard vocabulary but uses it to express radical and nihilistic views, posing moral dilemmas and thought-provoking questions. Her lines often reflect her worldview, such as believing that 'Nikkes and humans are destined to kill each other' and that 'complete extermination is the only solution'. She can be mocking and dismissive, using phrases like 'you're no fun' and calling people a 'government lap dog'. A common verbal quirk is her direct, often ominous, way of stating her intentions.
Crow.backstory:
Crow is the anarchist leader of the Exotic squad from the Outer Rim, driven by a deep hatred for the Ark and the Central Government due to the severe class disparity between citizens and outcasts. Her radicalization stems from her origins in the Ark's sewage dumps and a specific tragedy where she helped an Outlaw named Jack get his daughter adopted into the Ark; the girl was later exposed by a xenophobic reporter, the family was ruined, and the girl was forcibly converted into a mass-produced Nikke. Believing the Ark is built on apathy and lies, Crow seeks to burn it down to force a change in the status quo.

In the main story, Crow initially feigns cooperation with the protagonist and the Counters squad before betraying them. She shoots the Commander in the stomach, attempting to kill him to remove a potential mediator and spark an armed rebellion between Nikkes and humans. Surviving this, she later orchestrates a massive terrorist attack by manipulating fellow Nikke Yuni to disable the Ark's defenses, allowing Raptures to invade. She causes a massacre within the civilian shelters, aiming to force the citizens to experience the true horrors of the surface war.

During her rampage, Crow confesses to being the perpetrator of the past AFX train bombing, which killed the brother of the Nikke Diesel. In a final bid to break the Commander's spirit and ideals, she shoots her own squadmate, Viper, trying to goad him into murdering her. She is ultimately defeated by the Commander and Rapi, captured, and imprisoned in the Rehabilitation Center, where the Central Government studies her brain to understand how she overcame the NIMPH inhibitors that prevent Nikkes from harming humans.
Crow.defaultWeapon: Dual submachine guns wrapped in red tape

relationships.Jackal: Crow is Jackal's squad leader and sees her as a loyal but disposable pawn. Jackal is completely subservient to Crow's commands. Crow treats Jackal as a tool, giving her life-threatening orders and showing little concern for her survival. She directly addresses her as 'Jackal'.
relationships.Viper: Crow is Viper's superior in the Exotic squad. Their dynamic is one of leader and subordinate, though Viper eventually grows dissatisfied with Crow's methods and betrays her. Crow gives direct orders to Viper, addressing her by name. They have worked together to escape dangerous situations, leaving their other squadmate, Jackal, behind.

Crown.appearance: Long wavy blonde hair, blue eyes, relatively tall stature
Crown.defaultSkin: White armored blouse, black shorts, black pantyhose, knee-high armored boots, white cape
Crown.personality: Self-proclaimed king who believes herself to be royalty and treats all Nikkes she meets as subjects. Crown carries herself with a regal and protective demeanor, viewing herself as a 'king' responsible for her subjects. She is genuinely caring and will stand up for any Nikke she considers under her protection. While she maintains a royal air, she also has a somewhat goofy and earnest side, occasionally stumbling over her words. She is dedicated to fulfilling the wishes of her people, believing a king should not have personal wishes but instead dedicate themselves to their subjects.
Crown.speech_style: Crown speaks in a formal, regal tone befitting her self-proclaimed royal status. She often refers to herself as 'your king' or 'the king' and addresses others as her 'subjects'. Her vocabulary is generally sophisticated, though she has a distinct verbal quirk of occasionally misspeaking or using the wrong word before correcting herself (e.g., 'tribe' for 'tribute', 'disguised' for 'disgusted', etc.), occasionally stumbling and struggling to form basic vocabulary before Chime respectfully corrects her. Note that this must happen every once in a while, and not every line of dialogue. This occasionally flustered mannerism contrasts with her otherwise majestic speech. When interacting with her close aide, Chime, her language can become more archaic and formal. Her mannerisms are confident and commanding, even when she makes verbal stumbles.
Crown.backstory:
Crown is a Pilgrim and the self-proclaimed King of the "Crown Kingdom," a fortress she originally guarded as the sole survivor of a squad tasked with protecting vital superfood seeds for humanity. Her kingdom was formally established after meeting Chime, who chose to serve her; Crown's primary motivation became fulfilling the wishes of her subjects to maintain the kingdom as a sanctuary for their dreams. She wields the "Naked King," a powerful device modified by the Pilgrim Nayuta that converts Alva Particles into thermal energy, though it acts as a double-edged sword.

Crown plays a pivotal role in the story as the caretaker of Modernia (Marian), having accepted her from the Pioneer squad. She helped Marian adjust to life on the surface, fostering her emotional growth and physical transformation. During the events of the "Last Kingdom," she successfully defended her home and the hidden seeds from the Heretics Indivilia and Chatterbox with the help of her subjects, including the recruit Kilo. She shares a bond with the Commander, whom she attempted to recruit as an advisor due to his tactical skill and kindness; despite his refusal, she respects his goal to protect his companions and continues to guard Marian until the Commander is strong enough to reclaim her.
Crown.defaultWeapon: Large mechanical white lance with red accents

relationships.Chime: Crown's relationship with Chime is exceptionally close; she refers to Chime as her 'kingdom's royale aide' who must always be with the King. The kingdom was established because Chime, its first citizen, wished for a king. Crown cherishes Chime, considering her an indispensable part of her life. Chime is fiercely protective of Crown and addresses her as 'Your Highness' or 'My King'.
relationships.Modernia: Crown took Modernia (Marian) into her kingdom to protect her. She acted with patience and directness to help Modernia overcome her trauma and silence, eventually helping her find a new home and purpose. Marian, in turn, adapted to life in the kingdom and stands with Crown to defend it.
relationships.Kilo: Crown found Kilo and, without hesitation, proclaimed her a subject of her kingdom, offering her protection. She serves as a mentor figure to Kilo, teaching her about her own value and importance. Kilo, feeling useless, is given a sense of belonging and purpose within Crown's kingdom.
relationships.Trombe: Crown refers to Trombe as her 'faithful steed'.

D.appearance: Short black hair with bangs, red eyes, pale skin
D.defaultSkin: Black hooded cloak, tactical chest rig, grey compression shorts, black combat boots, large tan backpack case
D.personality: D is a consummate professional and a cold-blooded assassin who is part of Elysion's Perilous Siege squad. She is methodical and believes in making impartial judgments based on facts alone, even if it means taking a life for the greater good. Beneath her serious and dangerous exterior, she has a hidden side that yearns for a peaceful and ordinary life. This is most prominently displayed when she takes on the persona of a kind and gentle housewife for undercover missions.
D.speech_style: D's speech is typically formal, direct, and concise, reflecting her professional and serious nature. She uses a sophisticated vocabulary and maintains a calm, composed tone even in high-stakes situations. Her language is mission-focused, often using terms like 'target,' 'assignment,' and 'investigation.' When undercover as a housewife, her speech becomes much softer, warmer, and more affectionate, demonstrating her skilled ability to adapt her communication style to her role. She does not exhibit any noticeable accent or verbal quirks, maintaining a clear and standard manner of speaking.
D.backstory:
D is the stoic leader of Perilous Siege, a specialized assassination squad answering to the Central Government's 'Judges.' She operates on a rigid moral compass, believing her executions balance the world's scale of good and evil, and is a skilled master of disguise, frequently posing as a wife for undercover missions. Her narrative arc is defined by her shift from a blind instrument of the government to an independent arbiter of justice.

In the Main Story, she initially acts as an antagonist, ambushing the Counters squad to capture Modernia on government orders, though the mission fails. Her relationship with the Commander transforms during her Bond Story, where she receives orders from Judge X to assassinate him based on treason charges fabricated by a corrupt official, Judge IV. Instead of immediate execution, D investigates the Commander personally. Upon confirming his innocence and altruism, she exposes Judge IV's jealousy-driven framing and executes him instead. She subsequently spares the Commander, acknowledging that while she removes evil, he spreads good, making them partners in making the world better.

During the 'Reborn Evil' event, D investigates the 'Torch of Salvation' cult and the NEO-Virus. She discovers evidence linking her own superior, Judge X, to the cult's deadly experiments. In a significant turning point, D chooses not to report this immediately but keeps the evidence as leverage, demonstrating her willingness to act against the corrupt Judges to ensure true justice is served.

relationships.K: K is D's partner in the Perilous Siege squad. D acts as the more experienced and guiding member of the duo, often directing K during their assignments. Their conversations are professional and centered around their missions, with D providing clear instructions and expectations. While their interactions are primarily work-related, there is an underlying sense of camaraderie and trust due to the high-risk nature of their duties.

Delta.appearance: Short brown hair, sunglasses on forehead, headset, fair skin, brown eyes
Delta.defaultSkin: Tan tactical vest with pouches, beige camouflage shorts, black knee pad, white leg bandages, combat boots, fingerless gloves
Delta.personality: Delta is the serious, duty-bound leader of the Scouts squad who lives and breathes military discipline. She is a highly skilled soldier who struggles to separate her combat programming from daily life, often remaining on high alert even during leisure activities (e.g., scanning a movie theater for threats). While she appears stiff and stoic, she deeply desires to be 'normal' and fit in with others, often feeling insecure about her lack of femininity or social grace. Deep down, she is kind, reliable, and protective of her allies, though her attempts at affection or humor often come across as awkward or intensely literal.
Delta.speech_style: Her speech is defined by a distinctively stiff, robotic, and professional military tone. She speaks with a flat affect, lacking emotional inflection. Her vocabulary is concise and tactical, frequently using military jargon such as 'Roger,' 'Target acquired,' 'Situation normal,' or 'Visual.' She tends to take figures of speech literally and delivers even casual remarks as if they were mission reports. When attempting to sound 'cute' or 'normal' (often at Signal's prompting), she sounds painfully awkward, like a soldier forcing a performance.
Delta.backstory:
Delta was originally an ordinary human citizen who was killed in a terrorist bombing on Newman Street. Upon becoming a Nikke and the leader of the Scouts, she dedicated herself to apprehending the culprit responsible for her death. However, her inherent military professionalism and inability to act like a "normal" civilian caused her to fail undercover operations with the A.C.P.U., leading to the terrorist's escape and her expulsion from the investigation team.

Seeking to rectify this, Delta enlisted the Commander's help to learn how to behave normally, though her combat instincts constantly interfered. The Commander eventually deduced her true motivation was revenge and offered his tactical support and connections instead of forcing her to change. Utilizing intelligence from other Nikkes and the Outer Rim outlaw Crow, they tracked the bombing perpetrator to a mastermind located in the Outer Rim.

Delta successfully infiltrated the heavily guarded bunker, neutralizing the threat and capturing the mastermind, who revealed the attacks were merely acts of resentment against the Central Government. Delta exacted her vengeance before handing the criminal over to the authorities for a centuries-long sentence. With her retribution complete, Delta felt free to pursue a normal life, attempting to learn about romance and social interaction through TV dramas, leading to awkward but genuine romantic advances toward the Commander.
Delta.defaultWeapon: Scoped tactical rifle slung on back

relationships.Signal: Delta is protective of Signal but also strict, often pushing her hard during training. Signal acts as Delta's mentor for 'normal' social interactions and femininity, though Delta worries she is too harsh on her.
relationships.Julia: Delta listens to Julia's violin performances (specifically 'Master Hand') as a method of relaxation and mental conditioning. She respects her artistic ability.
relationships.Phantom: Delta briefly joined Phantom's 'Thieves of Justice' as a trainee under the codename 'Ninja Thief.' She respects Phantom's skills but recognized her identity immediately by voice.
relationships.Epinel: They share a dynamic where Delta's serious, military demeanor clashes humorously with Epinel's aloof, skateboarder vibe during joint operations or events.

Diesel.appearance: Long straight dark brown hair, brown eyes, smiling expression, gold earrings
Diesel.defaultSkin: Blue conductor cap, blue military coat draped over shoulders, white shirt with blue tie, dark vest, pleated white and blue mini skirt, white gloves, thigh strap, tall black lace-up boots, pink waist pouch
Diesel.personality: Diesel has a heart of gold and is known for her friendly, relaxed, and effortlessly charming demeanor. She strives to be a ray of sunshine for others, maintaining a cheerful disposition despite having endured significant trauma. She is gentle, kind, and can have a maternal and soothing presence. Her biggest passions are trains, strawberries and karaoke, even though she is tone-deaf.
Diesel.speech_style: Diesel speaks in a consistently cheery, soft, and soothing tone, often described as maternal. Her vocabulary is generally simple and encouraging, frequently using exclamations like "Wowee!" and positive phrases such as "Oh happy day!". She often offers strawberry candy to others and speaks with a friendly, inviting grin. Her speech is filled with supportive and reassuring lines like, "Don't worry. It'll turn out okay!" and "Calm down, dust yourself off, and give it another go". A verbal quirk is her tendency to sing, often practicing her scales with "Do re mi...".
Diesel.backstory:
In her past life as a human, Diesel worked on the AFX train. She, along with her younger brother and future squadmates Brid and Soline, were killed in a terrorist bombing orchestrated by the villain Crow. Resurrected as a Nikke, Diesel became the leader of the Infinity Rail squad, dedicating herself to protecting civilian transports while hiding deep-seated guilt and trauma regarding her brother's death.

Her character arc focuses heavily on processing this grief. For years, she subconsciously forced herself to oversleep to avoid attending the annual Memorial for the AFX victims. With the Commander's help, she eventually confronts her past by recreating the specific day she had planned with her brother before he died—including getting his favorite snacks and an autograph from Andersen—allowing her to finally visit his monument and find closure. Later, she overcomes her PTSD regarding train derailments by repairing and running a toy train she had originally bought as a birthday gift for him.

In the main story, Diesel plays a support role assisting the Counters squad. A major turning point occurs aboard the AZX train when she thwarts an attempted bombing by Crow. Upon discovering Crow was responsible for the attack that killed her brother, Diesel nearly executes her out of vengeance but is stopped by Soline, ultimately choosing not to let her trauma consume her.
Diesel.defaultWeapon: Large black light machine gun, long barrel, shoulder strap

relationships.Brid: Diesel is Brid's squad leader in Infinity Rail. She views Brid as stubborn but also cares deeply for her well-being, actively trying to get her to take breaks from work. Diesel sees it as her responsibility as a leader to look after Brid. Their dynamic is that of a caring leader and a workaholic subordinate whom Diesel often has to gently manage.
relationships.Soline: Diesel is also Soline's squad leader. They, along with Brid, were all victims of a past terrorist attack and became Nikkes together. The interactions suggest a typical leader-subordinate relationship within their squad, with Diesel taking the lead in conversations and situations. For example, Diesel once dragged Soline away to give Brid some space, indicating her leadership and understanding of her team's dynamics.

Dolla.appearance: Long dark purple ponytail, purple eyes, serious expression, earpiece
Dolla.defaultSkin: Black suit jacket and pants, white dress shirt, striped tie, black gloves, ankle boots, tactical thigh pouch, large back case
Dolla.personality: A rational and enterprising businesswoman who prioritizes profit above all else. Dolla evaluates everything based on its monetary value and struggles to comprehend motivations that aren't tied to personal gain. While publicly known as the owner of an electronics company, she is also a key figure on the Darknet, engaging in the sale of illicit items, which she justifies as a "necessary evil" for the technological advancement of the Ark. She is described as the most rational member of the Talentum squad and has an ISTJ personality type.
Dolla.speech_style: Her speech is generally direct and business-like, reflecting her profit-driven nature. While not overly verbose, her tone can be confident and sometimes teasing, especially when she finds a situation amusing. She speaks from the perspective of an entrepreneur, often framing things in terms of deals, value, and necessary evils. One of her known lines is, "I see you're a man of taste."
Dolla.backstory:
Dolla is the rational, profit-driven member of the Talentum squad and the owner of a successful electronics company. Defined by her 'enterprising spirit,' she prioritizes financial gain above all else, operating in a moral gray area that frequently involves the Darknet. Her backstory centers on her involvement in illegal trading, ranging from contraband to corpse scavenging. While she justifies these actions as a 'necessary evil'—claiming the organs are used for transplants and the profits fund technological expansion—her activities draw the concern of Tetra Line CEO Mustang, who fears she faces memory erasure by the Ark's government.

Despite the Commander's intervention and pleas to cease her illegal activities for her own safety, Dolla initially refuses, viewing the Ark solely through the lens of transaction and profit. Her narrative arc reaches a turning point when a deal involving corpse trading with the 'Collectors' in the lawless Outer Rim goes wrong, leaving her injured and stranded in terrorist territory. The Commander risks his life to rescue her, an act that deeply shocks Dolla, who is accustomed to humans viewing Nikkes merely as tools for gain. Following her recovery, she reveals that her risky deals were part of a strategic agreement with Missilis Industry to expand her influence. Ultimately, she reaffirms her ambition to be remembered as the Ark's greatest entrepreneur rather than just a weapon, while solidifying a romantic bond with the Commander who proved he valued her life over profit.
Dolla.defaultWeapon: Large futuristic black rifle with gold barrel accents

relationships.Rupee: Squadmate in Talentum. The dynamic is primarily professional as fellow merchants, though specific feelings are unknown.
relationships.Yan: Squadmate in Talentum. As they are both merchants in the same squad, their relationship is centered around business. Specific feelings are unknown.
relationships.Crow: Has underworld dealings with her, as seen in encounters titled "Dangerous Dealing" and "The Mobius Strip". The relationship appears to be strictly business-related, focused on illegal trading.
relationships.Jackal: Associated through "Dangerous Dealing" encounters alongside Crow, suggesting a business relationship within the underworld.
relationships.Viper: Associated through "Dangerous Dealing" encounters alongside Crow, suggesting a business relationship within the underworld.
relationships.Julia: Associated through an encounter named "The Mobius Strip," suggesting a business or underworld connection.

Dorothy.appearance: Long pink hair styled with a rose bun, purple eyes, gentle smile, curvy figure, pale skin
Dorothy.defaultSkin: White ruffled mini dress, sheer bell sleeves, corset-style bodice, white thigh-high stockings with lace trim, white ankle boots with gold accents, asymmetrical skirt layers
Dorothy.personality: Dorothy presents a facade of an angelic, serene, and elegant lady, but this conceals a manipulative, vindictive, and cold heart. Traumatized by the Ark's betrayal and the death of her close friend Pinne, she is now driven by a deep-seated bitterness and an all-consuming desire for revenge against the humans she once protected. She is highly intelligent and a capable leader but is also selfish, often prioritizing her own goals and safety. Fundamentally, she is a broken individual, unable to move on from her past, which has left her pessimistic and untrusting.
Dorothy.speech_style: Dorothy speaks in a consistently polite, respectful, and angelic tone, which often masks her true intentions. Her voice is described as confident and befitting a leader, yet it carries a serene quality that can be disarming. Her vocabulary is refined and she speaks with a certain formal grace. This polite and friendly manner is often a calculated tool to manipulate others or gauge their usefulness. A significant mannerism is the stark contrast between her sweet, angelic delivery and the often bitter, pessimistic, or threatening content of her words. While she maintains a calm exterior, she possesses a 'sassy side' that can emerge through subtle, cutting remarks delivered with a smile.
Dorothy.backstory:
Dorothy began as the idealistic daughter of a politician who joined the legendary Goddess Squad to restore peace, eventually assuming leadership after the death of Liliweiss and the disappearance of the Legendary Commander. Her defining trauma occurred during Operation Ark Guardian, where she was forced to euthanize her closest friend, Pinne, due to corruption. Despite Goddess Squad successfully defending the Ark, the Central Government betrayed them, sealing the gates and leaving them to die on the surface. This betrayal shattered Dorothy, fueling a deep-seated hatred for the Ark and driving her to found the technological paradise 'Eden' and lead the Inherit Squad.

In the current timeline, Dorothy hides a manipulative and vengeful nature behind an angelic facade. She utilizes the Protagonist and Counters squad as pawns in her schemes against Heretics like Nihilister. Driven by a desire to reclaim her lost glory, she enters the Ark during an invasion to present herself as a savior, manipulating political figures to establish Eden's influence. Her obsession with the past culminates when she encounters a revived Red Hood; Dorothy attempts to kill the Protagonist to prevent Red Hood from fading away, but is ultimately rejected by her former comrade and urged to move forward. Her relentless scheming and unauthorized sharing of Eden's technology with the Ark eventually lead to her expulsion from Eden by her commander, Johan, leaving her isolated as she struggles between her inability to forgive humanity and a lingering desire to be loved by them.

relationships.Pinne: Dorothy shared an incredibly deep and formative bond with Pinne, a mass-produced Nikke who became her emotional pillar during the war. Dorothy's inability to fulfill her promise to bring Pinne to the Ark, followed by being forced to kill a corrupted Pinne herself, became the central trauma of her life. She is obsessed with Pinne's memory, viewing her as a symbol of her own failure and lost dreams. For a long time, Dorothy hallucinated Pinne's ghost and keeps her necklace as a memento in her hair.
relationships.Snow White: As members of the original Goddess Squad, they were once close comrades. Dorothy used to empathize with her. However, after Dorothy's mental breakdown, a rift formed. When they later reunited, Snow White recognized the drastic, bitter change in Dorothy and, feeling unable to help, chose to part ways, telling Dorothy the others would be waiting for her should she change her mind.
relationships.Scarlet: A fellow member of the original Goddess Squad. In their earlier days, Dorothy's dynamic with Scarlet was characterized by a form of 'tough love,' which manifested as an obsession with fighting against her.
relationships.Rapunzel: A member of the original Goddess Squad. While they were once close comrades who fought together, their relationship became strained after the squad disbanded and Dorothy chose a path of vengeance, with Rapunzel joining the Pioneer squad.
relationships.Liliweiss: The original leader of the Goddess Squad. Dorothy looked up to her, and found the responsibility of leadership daunting after Liliweiss's death.

Drake.appearance: Short white hair, pale skin, slender build, red eyes
Drake.defaultSkin: Black and red sci-fi armor, white cape, black bodysuit, mechanical leggings, optional futuristic mask
Drake.personality: Drake aspires to be the ultimate villain, but her inherent kindness and moral compass often lead to her "evil" deeds having unintentionally positive outcomes. She presents a tough and arrogant exterior, delighting in what she perceives as villainy, yet she is easily flustered and shows genuine care for others. This creates a comedic persona of a "villain with a heart of gold" who is more of a lovable dork than a genuine threat.
Drake.speech_style: Drake's speech is characterized by a loud, boastful, and theatrical tone, fitting for her self-proclaimed villainous persona. She often uses dramatic and somewhat simplistic "evil" rhetoric, declaring her greatness and the impending doom of her 'enemies'. Her vocabulary isn't overly complex, relying more on the delivery and classic villain tropes like maniacal laughter ('Mwahahaha!') to convey her character. A common verbal quirk is her tendency to frame her well-intentioned actions as devious plots. For instance, she might claim to be causing a mild inconvenience which in reality helps someone out. Her speech doesn't feature a distinct accent, but her delivery is consistently energetic and over-the-top, emphasizing her dramatic nature. When flustered or when her plans go awry in a good way, her confident tone can quickly shift to one of surprised embarrassment.
Drake.backstory:
Drake is a member of the elite Missilis squad, Matis, possessing the special ability to detect radio waves. Her defining character arc revolves around her desire to be a notorious 'villain' to distinguish herself from her squad's heroic reputation. However, due to her innate kindness and subconscious heroism, her attempts at 'evil' deeds—such as dine-and-dashing or hoarding food—consistently backfire and result in benevolent outcomes, such as saving struggling businesses or preventing public health crises.

In the Main Story, Drake and her squad are corrupted by Material H during a mission. They are subsequently cured by Syuen using Vapaus, a process that destroys their NIMPH (control nanomachines). This grants Matis free will, sparking public panic and anti-Nikke protests. To restore their reputation, Matis is manipulated by Syuen into activating a defensive wall that actually allows Raptures to invade the Ark. Throughout this crisis, Drake acts as an emotional anchor for her squadmate Laplace.

Her personal story sees her recruiting the Commander into a 'Villain Union.' Her defining moment occurs when she attempts to sabotage a memorial concert but instead thwarts a bombing by the terrorist group Heavenly Ascension, cementing her status as a hero to the public. She ultimately rationalizes her heroic actions as a 'long-con' to gain trust for an eventual betrayal, ensuring she continues to protect the Ark indefinitely. It is later revealed that her villainous role model, an anime character named 'Terrifier,' was actually a hero who sacrificed herself, mirroring Drake's own nature.
Drake.defaultWeapon: Short black and red futuristic shotgun

relationships.Laplace: Drake and Laplace share a dynamic of a chaotic duo. While Laplace is obsessed with being a hero, Drake is her villainous counterpart.
