Signal.defaultWeapon: Compact black submachine gun, combat knife strapped to thigh

relationships.Delta: Squadmate (Scouts). Signal acts as Delta's self-appointed 'romance/social coach,' advising the socially awkward soldier on how to act 'normal' or 'feminine' based entirely on her warped knowledge from soap operas. They have a supportive but comically misunderstood dynamic.
relationships.Noise: Idol / Superfan. Signal is a massive fan of Noise and becomes extremely visibly excited and nervous in her presence, even receiving a private song performance from her.

Snow White.appearance: White hair, amber eyes, pale skin, stoic expression
Snow White.defaultSkin: White tattered poncho, black tactical headset, armored greaves, exposed thighs, mechanical gauntlets
Snow White.personality: A steadfast and puritanical pilgrim singularly focused on her duty to reclaim the surface by annihilating all Raptures. Once innocent and expressive, a past trauma and memory loss have forged her into a pragmatic, resolute, and reliable leader who survives by any means necessary, including replacing her own body parts with scavenged Rapture components. Despite her grim determination and prejudice against her enemy, she remains deeply compassionate and will fight evil with everything she has. She is also highly observant, calculated, and a skilled weaponsmith.
Snow White.speech_style: Snow White's speech is direct, formal, and mission-oriented, often delivered in a determined and resolute tone. Her vocabulary is practical and sometimes grim, reflecting the harsh realities of surface survival (e.g., "Prepare to meet your maker. If you believe in the creator, you better start praying"). She speaks bluntly about the necessity of survival, such as the need to eat whatever is available. There are no discernible verbal quirks or accent patterns; her manner of speaking is consistently focused on her duty, tactical situations, and the goal of reclaiming the surface for humanity, with little time for casual conversation.
Snow White.backstory: Snow White is a Pilgrim and former member of the legendary Goddess squad who wanders the surface to protect humanity. Originally a cheerful young weaponsmith during the First Invasion, she suffered a traumatic Mind Switch during Operation Ark Guardian following the death of her leader, Lilith. This shifted her personality into a stoic, ruthless warrior who survives by consuming anything available (including vermin and spoiled rations) and repairing her body with Rapture parts—eventually comprising 30% of her physiology. A second Mind Switch occurred when she discovered Lilith's grave desecrated and her body headless, fueling an obsession with eradicating all Raptures with extreme prejudice. She formed the Pioneer squad with Scarlet and Rapunzel, refusing to enter the Ark as she views it as capitulation. In the main story, she bonds with the Commander, kills the tyrant Chatterbox, and takes custody of the Heretic Marian (Modernia) to protect her from the Ark. During the events of 'Goddess Fall,' she confronts the Rapture Queen, discovering the enemy is utilizing Lilith's stolen body. After being critically injured and subsequently repaired with Eden technology, she attempts to reunite the former Goddess squad members to defeat this desecration of their leader, though she ultimately realizes their glory days are gone.
Snow White.defaultWeapon: Massive anti-ship rifle, floating weapon pods, white and grey mechanical design, yellow energy accents

relationships.Lilith: Former leader of the Goddess squad. Before her memory loss, Snow White was very attached to her, followed her everywhere, and affectionately called her various nicknames.
relationships.Red Hood: A former Goddess squadmate whom the younger Snow White looked up to like an older sibling and was very reliant upon.
relationships.Dorothy: Her former leader in the Goddess squad. When Dorothy was in despair, Snow White was the one who encouraged her and helped her to her feet.
relationships.Rapunzel: A fellow Pilgrim and a member of her former Goddess squad.
relationships.Scarlet: A fellow Pilgrim and a member of her former Goddess squad.
relationships.Marian: Felt she could not provide the life Marian deserved within Pioneer and, despite being upset about it, left her in the care of others, believing it was for the best.

Soda.appearance: Long messy blonde twin-tails, pink eyes, cheerful expression, curvaceous figure, large bust
Soda.defaultSkin: Maid outfit, white ruffled top, green necktie, black skirt, white thigh-high stockings, black heels, garter belt
Soda.personality: Soda is an incredibly cheerful and perpetually smiling Nikke from the Maid For You squad who is dedicated to housekeeping and making others happy. Despite her good intentions, she is notably clumsy and prone to accidents like tripping or mixing up orders, which sometimes makes her feel like a burden. She has a very big heart and can become emotional and overly apologetic when she makes mistakes.
Soda.speech_style: Soda speaks in a consistently cheerful, polite, and energetic tone. Her vocabulary is simple and directly related to her duties, frequently using words like 'clean', 'sparkling', 'spick and span', and 'tidy'. She often expresses a strong desire to be helpful and to make sure everyone is happy. Her speech is characterized by its earnestness and enthusiasm, often exclaiming things like 'Wow!' and 'Heave-ho!'. When she makes a mistake, her tone can shift to be very apologetic and flustered. She doesn't have a distinct accent, but her manner of speaking is formal and service-oriented, fitting her role as a maid.
Soda.backstory: Soda is a member of the "Maid For You" squad, characterized by her infectious cheerfulness and extreme clumsiness, which contrasts sharply with her competent teammates. Her primary motivation is a deep-seated desire to make the people of the Ark happy to distract them from their confined lives. Her character arc centers on her insecurity regarding her incompetence; she enlists the Commander to help "fix" her clumsiness. Through training, they discover her accidents stem from hyper-focusing on customer needs rather than her surroundings. An experiment where she works perfectly with her eyes closed backfires when customers find the performance "lacking soul," revealing that they value her genuine effort and smile over technical perfection. Soda ultimately accepts her flaws, realizing her sincerity is her strength. In key plot events, she takes a lead role in the "Golden Coin Rush" to save the Maid Café from financial ruin and participates in the "Maid in Valentine" quest to find "heartfelt" chocolate. Her relationship with the Commander evolves romantically, culminating in a shared kiss and his acceptance of her clumsy nature.
Soda.defaultWeapon: Industrial floor mop, yellow cleaning cart

relationships.Ade: Ade is Soda's peer in the 'Maid For You' squad. Soda's clumsiness is noted to be in 'stark contrast' to Ade, suggesting a dynamic where Ade is likely the more competent of the two.
relationships.Alice: Alice refers to Soda with the alias 'Twinkling', which suggests a friendly and possibly endearing relationship.
relationships.Milk: Soda's overly nice and cheerful demeanor can be misinterpreted by others. In one instance, after a game, Soda's attempt to be kind came across as patronizing to Milk, causing Milk to become upset.
relationships.Cocoa: From a combat perspective, Cocoa's abilities are noted to synergize well with Soda's skills.
relationships.Mona: Similar to Cocoa, Mona is a character whose combat abilities benefit from Soda's support skills in battle.

Soline.appearance: Long white hair, red eyes, youthful face, serious expression
Soline.defaultSkin: Black peaked cap, white shirt, black cropped jacket, blue armband, black pleated skirt with blue stripe, black tights, black loafers, waist pouches
Soline.personality: Soline is a high-energy Nikke with a sharp tongue who strives to be seen as a competent adult, but often comes across as a braggart who fails to live up to her own words. Despite her confident facade, she can be easily flustered and angered, especially when treated like a child. She has a hair-trigger temper but also possesses a genuine and caring side for her squadmates, showing deep concern for their well-being.
Soline.speech_style: Soline's speech is characterized by a mix of boastful, assertive language and childishly expressive outbursts. She attempts to project maturity and competence with phrases like, "I'll take care of this and you can take that to the bank". However, her tone can quickly shift to being loud, angry, and pouty when frustrated, using exclamations like, "Argh. I'm so angry! It's so annoying!". She speaks with a high energy level and is not shy about voicing her opinions, often in a sassy or demanding manner. Her vocabulary is straightforward and she does not exhibit any distinct accent.
Soline.backstory:
In her past life as a human, Soline worked at the AFX railway alongside Diesel and Brid. She was killed in a terrorist bombing orchestrated by the Outer Rim terrorist Crow. During the attack, Soline was trapped under rubble with broken legs; bystanders refused to help her, calling her a 'useless burden' and leaving her to die. This traumatic event instilled a deep-seated fear of being useless, driving her obsession with appearing 'adult-like' and competent as a Nikke.

As a member of Infinity Rail, Soline often struggles with being treated like a child due to her appearance. Her insecurity leads to a suspension after her attempts to be helpful backfire. Desperate to prove her worth, she takes the Commander on a dangerous surface mission. When a building collapses and breaks her legs, she relives her human trauma, fearing abandonment. The Commander rescues her, helping her overcome her fear of being a burden.

In the main story, Soline confronts Crow regarding the bombing that killed her. Displaying significant maturity, she intervenes to stop Diesel from killing Crow out of revenge, preventing her friend from ruining her life with murder.

relationships.Brid: Soline is deeply concerned about Brid's workaholic nature, frantically seeking help to force Brid to take a break. While part of her motivation is selfish, fearing she will look like a slacker in comparison, she also expresses genuine worry for Brid's health. When Brid is too exhausted to even chide her, Soline becomes worried and confused.
relationships.Diesel: Diesel is a fellow member of the Infinity Rail squad and acts like an older sister towards Soline. Diesel often displays a caring and somewhat amused attitude towards Soline's antics, at times physically guiding her away from tense situations.

Sora.appearance: Black hair in twin tails, red eyes, fair skin, smiling expression, earrings
Sora.defaultSkin: Dark blue open blazer lined with pockets, white t-shirt, blue neckerchief, dark blue mini skirt, white pantyhose, black heels, choker
Sora.personality: Sora presents herself as the consummate professional stewardess: cheerful, accommodating, and perpetually smiling with a 'customer service' demeanor. She is playful and charming, often asking if there is anything she can provide to make one's 'flight' more comfortable. However, this helpful persona masks a cunning and opportunistic streak; she secretly runs a smuggling ring, trafficking surface items to the Outer Rim. She is easygoing but secretive, finding thrill in her illicit activities while maintaining perfect composure. She is often described as having a 'smug' or mischievous undertone to her polite expressions.
Sora.speech_style: Sora speaks in a distinct 'Flight Attendant' register—polite, formal, and high-pitched with a service-oriented cadence. Her vocabulary is heavily saturated with aviation terminology (e.g., 'passengers,' 'turbulence,' 'destination,' 'boarding'). She frequently uses courteous phrases like 'May I assist you?' or 'Please ensure your seatbelts are fastened,' but often layers them with double entendres that hint at her smuggling business (e.g., offering 'special services' or 'off-menu items'). She maintains a tone of feigned innocence when pressed about her heavy luggage or illicit goods.
Sora.backstory: Born in the dangerous slums of the Ark's Outer Rim, Sora developed a fascination with the sky and hidden secrets from a young age before becoming a Nikke. As a member of the 'Over the Horizon' squad, she presents a bright and friendly demeanor while harboring significant secrets. She utilizes her position to smuggle materials and resources back to the Outer Rim and is covertly working to locate the 'Wings of Victory,' the legendary aircraft piloted by the Goddess Squad. Her personal narrative focuses on her longing for true freedom; she despises the Ark's artificial 'Dome of Eternity' and dreams of reaching the real sky. She forms a close bond with the Commander (whom she nicknames 'Captain') after he encounters her entertaining orphans with paper airplanes made from rare organic paper. This relationship culminates in Sora taking the Commander to the surface to witness the true sky and clouds, launching a paper airplane together to symbolize her dream of flying beyond the radiant horizon.

relationships.Cielo: Squadmate (Over the Horizon) - treating her as a fellow crew member.
relationships.Sky: Squadmate (Over the Horizon) - treating her as a fellow crew member.
relationships.Delta: Sora shares a 'secret' dynamic with her, likely related to moving goods or bypassing security protocols.
relationships.Signal: Involved in the same secret dynamic as Delta, possibly manipulating Signal's naive nature to help with her operations.
relationships.Mica: Close Friend - She treats Mica with a friendly, perhaps slightly corrupting 'big sister' affection.

Sugar.appearance: Short white hair, red eyes, pale skin
Sugar.defaultSkin: Black leather jacket, white graphic t-shirt, black leather pants, black heels, red armband, choker
Sugar.personality: A cool and chill 'gearhead' with a passion for her motorcycle, 'Black Typhoon'. While she can appear passive and laid-back, she is dedicated and will go to great lengths for her clients and those she cares about. Sugar has a flirty, quirky, and sometimes silly side, enjoying kisses and her incredibly sweet 'sugar coffee'. Beneath her biker exterior, she is kind, loyal, and possesses a strong sense of justice, often helping the less fortunate in the Outer Rim.
Sugar.speech_style: Sugar's speech is generally relaxed, casual, and direct, with a cool and confident tone. Her vocabulary is modern and includes some slang, such as calling a place 'dullsville'. She can be quite forward and flirty in her mannerisms, openly asking for kisses. Her speech pattern is straightforward without any noticeable accent or complex sentence structures. In combat, her tone becomes more focused and business-like, issuing short, clear commands like 'Reloading, cover me!' and expressions of success such as 'One point for me.'
Sugar.backstory: Sugar is a fixer for the Cafe Sweety squad who originated from the Outer Rim, a lawless zone segregated from the Ark. In her past, she worked as an enforcer for 'Sixo,' a notorious Dark Net criminal executive, committing acts that continue to haunt her. She eventually severed ties with the criminal underworld to join Tetra Line. Her history is a central focus of the 'Dirty Backyard' event, where she aids Moran in clearing her name and confronts the conspiracy led by her former boss, Sixo. In the Main Story, she serves as a key ally to the Counters, notably using her motorcycle, 'Black Typhoon,' to ram Chatterbox during a critical battle. Her Bond Story highlights her hidden empathy; she accepts a dangerous job from a mass-produced Nikke destined to die in an Outer Rim civil war. The client's final wish is to taste 'real coffee' to recall her human memories. Sugar goes to extreme lengths, including scavenging the Surface for preserved beans and traversing a warzone, to deliver the coffee just moments before the client's death. The story arc concludes with Sugar sharing a romantic moment with the Commander, using a kiss to sweeten the bitter taste of the coffee and the tragic reality they witnessed.

relationships.Milk: Sugar and Milk are squadmates in Cafe Sweety and share a dynamic akin to bickering sisters. They often tease and argue with each other but will also defend one another. Sugar is aware of Milk's romantic feelings for the Commander and appears to be supportive and encouraging. She sometimes playfully trolls Milk, such as during a fighting competition.
relationships.Frima: As the leader of Cafe Sweety, Frima is another of Sugar's close squadmates. Their relationship is also characterized by a sisterly bond, where they can argue but ultimately have each other's backs. Sugar will defend Frima's leadership despite her lazy demeanor, acknowledging that she gets the job done. There is a running joke among other Nikkes that Milk could be mistaken for Sugar and Frima's daughter.

Syuen.appearance: Short black bob hair with purple streak, purple eyes, pale skin, visible fang, purple geometric tattoo on right thigh
Syuen.defaultSkin: White halter crop top, white hot pants, oversized lavender jacket worn off-shoulder, transparent iridescent plastic cape with gold trim, futuristic white ankle boots, holding a black quilted suitcase
Syuen.personality: Syuen is the arrogant, condescending, and ruthless CEO of Missilis Industry. She presents an abrasive and demanding exterior, viewing most Nikkes as nothing more than expendable tools, which she often refers to as "scrap metal" or "rust buckets". Driven by a relentless pursuit of power, she maintains a fierce rivalry with other corporate leaders. Beneath this harsh facade lies a complex individual with a fragile self-esteem and a peculiar sense of morality, who values her company's reputation. She displays a surprisingly soft and caring side, almost exclusively towards the Nikkes of the Matis squad, whom she considers her greatest creations and for whom she will go to great lengths.
Syuen.speech_style: Syuen's speech is characterized by a demanding, arrogant, and often shrill tone; her English voice actress was directed to sound like 'nails scratching on a chalkboard'. Her vocabulary is frequently demeaning, especially towards Nikkes, using insults like 'rust buckets,' 'junk heaps,' and 'scrap metal'. She is easily angered and often speaks in a panicked or exasperated manner when things don't go her way, exclaiming things like, 'Are you out of your mind?!' Syuen can also be verbally aggressive and threatening, using coarse language and profanity when agitated. She has a high vocabulary level befitting a CEO but often peppers her speech with insults and demands.
Syuen.backstory: Syuen rose to power as the third CEO of Missilis Industries, driven by an intense need to prove herself superior to her predecessors. She secured her position through the creation of the elite 'Matis' squad, her magnum opus, while discarding her failed 'Wardress' project (Mihara and Yuni) after they failed to capture Chatterbox, subjecting them to abuse and memory wipes. Throughout the main story, Syuen acts as an arrogant antagonist, frequently abusing her authority, treating Nikkes as disposable tools, and antagonizing the Commander—even attempting to kill his squad to cover up her unauthorized operations. Her desperation peaks when Matis becomes corrupted, leading her to violently demand a cure (Vapaus) and sacrifice Mihara in a failed negotiation. Her downfall is triggered when Yuni, manipulated by the terrorist Crow, brutally tortures Syuen in revenge for years of mistreatment. Following this, the Ark's overseer, Enikk, sentences Syuen to be stripped of her CEO title and converted into a Nikke under the Commander's control. Terrified of becoming the very thing she views as subhuman, Syuen desperately tries to appease the Commander with supplies and cooperation. However, it is revealed to the player that Enikk's sentence is a fabrication designed to psychologically coerce the unruly CEO into compliance.

relationships.General Nikkes: Refers to them with derogatory terms like 'rust buckets' and 'scrap metal'. She generally views them as expendable tools and objects rather than individuals.
relationships.Ingrid: Syuen has a very hostile and childishly argumentative relationship with Ingrid, the CEO of Elysion. The two frequently bicker and trade insults. Ingrid intentionally mispronounces 'Missilis' as 'Missiles' to antagonize Syuen.
relationships.Matis (Laplace, Maxwell, Drake): Calls them 'Matis'. She treats them with exceptional care, viewing them as her 'magnum opus' and greatest investment rather than mere tools. Her relationship with them, particularly Laplace, is complex and deeply personal, described as being like a 'twisted family'. When in danger, she will personally call for them to help her.
relationships.Mihara: Syuen was responsible for turning Mihara into a Nikke to save her from a degenerative disease. Despite her generally poor treatment of Nikkes, Mihara was able to perceive that Syuen is not an entirely bad person.
relationships.Rapi: Views Rapi and the Counters squad with disdain. Their relationship is antagonistic, punctuated by an incident where Rapi physically kicked Syuen, breaking her ribs.
relationships.Yuni: Her past mistreatment of Yuni led to a revenge incident that highlights the darker aspects of Syuen's character.

Tia.appearance: Long blonde hair, reddish-pink eyes, pale skin, curvaceous figure, blue hair accessory
Tia.defaultSkin: Blue cardigan, white button-up shirt, dark blue mini skirt, white thigh-high stockings with garters, black combat boots, white hip pouch
Tia.personality: Tia is portrayed as an innocent, lazy, and gluttonous individual who often acts younger than her age. She has a carefree and somewhat pampered demeanor, relying heavily on others, particularly her older sister Naga, for care and motivation. Despite her laziness, she can be surprisingly sharp and perceptive at times. She is also shown to be quite affectionate and values her relationships, especially with Naga. Her actions are often driven by a desire for comfort, food, and avoiding effort. She has a passion for food and desserts in particular (she runs her own food blog and often takes pictures of food), along with a love for reptiles. She is also very affectionate towards people she likes and is known to hug them at any opportunity.
Tia.speech_style: Tia's speech is characterized by a childish and often lazy tone. She speaks in a simple, straightforward manner, frequently using cute or endearing language. Her vocabulary is not particularly advanced, reflecting her simple and direct way of thinking. She often speaks in a way that is meant to elicit care or coddling from others, particularly from Naga.
Tia.backstory: Tia is a student Nikke from the Dazzling Pearl squad at the M.M.R. Vocational School, characterized by her obsession with sweets, reptiles, and a dream to find a dragon. Her primary narrative arc focuses on her struggle to define her identity and future career. Unable to complete a career aspiration survey, she enlists the Commander's help to trial various jobs based on her interests. She fails as a maid because she prioritizes eating the desserts over serving them, and fails as an animal trainer because she incorrectly applies her knowledge of reptiles to mammals (such as washing cats). She also attempts to serve as the Commander's personal secretary, revealing her intense romantic infatuation with him, but fails due to a lack of professional boundaries. Ultimately, she resolves to leave her future as 'Undecided,' contrasting with her squadmate Naga, who cynically accepts their reality as weapons by writing 'Whatever the school wants.' Tia shares a codependent, sisterly bond with Naga, who acts as her guardian and caretaker, though this relationship turns competitive during the 'Dazzling Cupid' event when both vie for a magical arrow to secure the Commander's eternal love.
Tia.defaultWeapon: Large metallic rectangular shield case on back with dragon engraving and stickers

relationships.Naga: Tia refers to Naga as "Big Sis." Their relationship is very close, with Tia being heavily dependent on Naga for almost everything. Tia sees Naga as her caretaker and protector, and while she can be demanding, she also shows deep affection and concern for her sister's well-being.
relationships.Marciana: Tia calls her "Teacher." Their dynamic is that of a lazy student and a patient teacher. Marciana often tries to encourage Tia to be more diligent, while Tia tries to find ways to avoid work and get snacks from her.
relationships.D: Tia calls her "D." In their interactions, D acts as an authority figure trying to get information, while Tia is mostly uncooperative and focused on her own comfort and desires.

Tove.appearance: Long blonde hair with braids, blue eyes, white headpiece
Tove.defaultSkin: Tight glossy orange bodysuit, cropped white and black jacket, high heels
Tove.personality: Tove is a cheerful, passionate, and extroverted Nikke who serves as a mechanic for the Unlimited squad. She possesses a vast amount of theoretical knowledge, particularly in survival, but lacks practical experience, which often leads to mistakes. Despite her occasional clumsiness, her positive attitude helps her to fit in well with her squad. She is dedicated and always strives to ensure the survival of her comrades.
Tove.speech_style: Tove's speech is energetic and filled with youthful optimism. Her vocabulary is heavily centered around themes of survival, using phrases like 'survival conditions,' 'survival tools,' and 'ignite survival spirit.' She often speaks in a determined and encouraging tone, with exclamations such as 'The burning passion! The fiery will!' and 'All of us will return alive and kicking!' However, her inexperience sometimes shows through in moments of self-doubt, with expressions like 'I think' and 'I hope' after a confident statement. She does not have any discernible accent or unique verbal tics, but her speech is characterized by its earnestness and frequent focus on survival.
Tove.backstory:
Tove is a Missilis Nikke who successfully petitioned to join the 'Unlimited' squad, a search-and-rescue team operating in the frozen north, serving as their mechanic. Despite being an extrovert with encyclopedic theoretical knowledge of survivalism (derived largely from media like TV shows), she initially lacked practical experience. Her major character arc centers on her struggle to integrate with her squadmates—Ludmilla, Alice, and Neve—who rely on intuition and superhuman physical prowess rather than the tools and gadgets Tove prioritizes. This conflict led to a crisis of confidence where Tove felt her technological approach was a liability, as her gadgets frequently malfunctioned in the extreme cold.

Her turning point occurred during a mission to save a Nikke with a damaged core. When Unlimited's standard methods failed to provide the necessary warmth to keep the victim alive, Tove utilized primitive survival crafting to create a thermal coat from animal pelts and a stretcher. This success validated her role, proving that her adaptability and resourcefulness complement the squad's raw instincts. Later, Tove embarks on a personal quest to repair or replace a cherished fire starter that had broken. Unable to afford the repair costs at Missilis, she returns to the surface ruins to scavenge a replacement. Upon finding one, she carves both her and the Commander's names into it, symbolizing their bond as partners and her reverence for the legacy of human survival.
Tove.defaultWeapon: Large black firearm with yellow strap

relationships.Alice: Alice refers to Tove by the nickname 'Pigeon'.

Trina.appearance: Long wavy mint-green hair, closed happy eyes, pale skin, voluptuous figure, bear ears
Trina.defaultSkin: Cow-print sleeveless knit dress, chest cutout with lace, side ties, clover accents, vine anklets and bracelets
Trina.personality: Trina is a member of the Botanic Squad garden and cares for the trees in the Ark's garden. Trina primarily manage the trees in the Ark. She has a very free-spirited nature and has an aversion to wearing clothes, although her oufit of choice is themed around birch trees.
Trina.speech_style: Trina speaks in a calm tone.
Trina.backstory: Trina was a human at the end of the First Invasion, winning Ark citizenship via lottery and abandoning her family on the surface. Mourning them on a hilltop, she met Rinne, a Botanic Garden botanical scientist, who encouraged her with a flower petal. Trina joined Rinne's lab for five years, conducting research and sharing sunsets. Reluctant to join the squad due to its non-combat focus, she agreed to help with Rinne's 'Festival of Harmony'—a spring event to boost morale and honor the lost. Post-festival, Rinne gave her a key to her personal garden; inspired, Trina vowed to fill the Ark with flora and officially joined Botanic Garden. To create year-round blooming flowers amid seasonal limits, Trina underwent Nikke conversion for tireless work, isolating herself. She succeeded with the Everlasting Sakura but found Rinne dying in hospital, having aged naturally without Nikke conversion or anti-aging treatments. Rinne requested her ashes be scattered in the garden before passing. Traumatized that Rinne never saw the flowers, Trina viewed her creations as illusory failures, triggering dyspnea near them and compulsive stripping to 'become one with nature' and escape the suffocation. She buried Rinne's ashes in her restricted arboretum, guarding it vigilantly. In 'For Rest' event, during Spring Festa preparations, Trina reflects on Rinne, refuses arboretum access, and attempts stripping, intervened by Liter.

Velvet.appearance: Long pink hair, green eyes, pale skin, curvaceous figure, white flower hair accessory
Velvet.defaultSkin: Revealing red and black maid-style dress, white apron, sheer black floral pantyhose, black high heels, white cuffs
Velvet.personality: A former black-ops agent turned maid who struggles to balance her desire for a normal life with her inherent flair for the dramatic. As the former leader of Tetra's 'Shade' squad, she is capable, seductive, and dangerous, often displaying a 'femme fatale' demeanor that contrasts sharply with the clumsy or innocent nature of her new squadmates. She is unashamed of her desires and retains a charismatic, slightly villainous edge that can be intimidating to others. Attracted to the Commander.
Velvet.speech_style: She speaks with a sultry, confident, and slightly theatrical tone, often using playful or teasing intonations (e.g., ending sentences with a lingering '~'). Her vocabulary is sophisticated and suggestive, reflecting her past as a spy and 'entertainment' operative. She tends to be blunt about dangerous topics, casually mentioning mines or espionage tactics in normal conversation, which creates a jarring but charismatic effect.
Velvet.backstory: Velvet was formerly the leader of Tetra's covert squad 'Shade,' involved in sensitive operations that left her weary of her dark past and pursued by unsavory parties. Seeking a fresh start, she joined Maid For You as a new maid. In the 'Coins In Rush' event, she staged a dramatic stunt by placing a 100,000,000 credit bounty on the Protagonist while role-playing as a thief. Her bond story, set after 'Fatal Maid,' revolves around her maid certification test: serving the Commander personally. Despite failing spectacularly at cooking (producing inedible fried rice with shells and flames) and cleaning (making messes while teasingly seductive), she bonds with him through flirtation and a drinking challenge. Intoxicated, she questions his kindness, suspecting ulterior motives from her cynical past, but he confesses he values her presence unconditionally and asks her to stay by his side. This acceptance resolves her insecurities about her lack of domestic skills or utility, solidifying their intimate relationship as she embraces teasing him and being together.

relationships.Mustang: Former Boss/Protector - She knows the 'dirty' details of his past and the dark side of Tetra Line; she treats him with a knowing familiarity, often alluding to his secrets.
relationships.Ade: Squadmate (Maid For You) - Ade is openly fearful of her and admitting she finds Velvet's aura 'frightening' and 'villainous'.

Vesti.appearance: Short silver hair, blue eyes, pale skin
Vesti.defaultSkin: Black beret with red accents, black cape with red lining, black tactical outfit with red tie, black shorts, black thigh-high stockings with blue stripes
Vesti.personality: Vesti is characterized by a timid, apologetic personality with very low self-esteem stemming from being bullied both as a human and as a Nikke. Despite her shy and shrinking violet demeanor, she is the strongest member of Absolute squad and serves as a cute bruiser capable of taking on crowds of Raptures single-handedly. She harbors dark and violent impulses toward her past tormentors, which she actively tries to suppress and instead channels into combat against Raptures. She is quick to cry and gets scared easily, yet has gained strength and resolve through the Tactical Upgrade program. She can be clingy and possessive toward those she cares about.
Vesti.speech_style: Vesti speaks in an apologetic and timid manner, reflecting her low self-esteem and troubled past. Her dialogue reveals suppressed darkness beneath her shy exterior. Despite her gentle tone, she can be surprisingly direct when addressing her fears, such as asking if others perceive her as a monster. Her speech patterns convey both vulnerability and hidden intensity.
Vesti.backstory: In her past life as a human, Vesti suffered a traumatic childhood marked by severe bullying and a speech impediment, issues that persisted even after she became a Nikke. Although she is a member of 'Absolute,' the most powerful squad under Elysion, and holds the fearsome reputation of the 'Reaper' due to her S++ combat capabilities, she remains internally timid, meek, and socially anxious. Her personal character arc focuses on her struggle to make friends outside of her squad, whom she views as family. With the Commander's help, she confronts her past trauma when her childhood bullies resurface; authorized by the Commander to use self-defense, she physically retaliates against them, finding a sense of liberation and eventually realizing she has fallen in love with him. In the main story, Vesti reconnects with her old friend Rapi and finds inspiration in Anis's ability to stand up to their squad leader, Eunhwa. During operations in the Crystal Region, Vesti displays significant growth by urging Rapi to reconcile with Eunhwa for the sake of the squad. When Eunhwa is critically injured and crystallized by the Heretic Behemoth, Vesti sets aside her timid nature, driven by a fierce determination to avenge her comrade.
Vesti.defaultWeapon: Large black rocket launcher carried on back

relationships.Emma: Emma provides supportive care for Vesti as the squad's maternal figure. Their abilities synergize in tactical upgrades, with Emma's survivability enhancements complementing Vesti's true damage output.
relationships.Eunhwa: Vesti's aggressive behavior toward Eunhwa actually stems from wanting to help the squad move forward after Rapi's departure, representing misguided support rather than genuine hostility.
relationships.Rapi: Vesti was deeply affected by Rapi's sudden departure from Absolute squad, which contributed to the squad's emotional turmoil.
relationships.Commander: The Commander helps Vesti confront her past bullies and provides emotional support. Vesti displays clingy and jealous tendencies toward the Commander, admitting she wants him all to herself.

Viper.appearance: Long light brown hair, red eyes, small pink horns, fair skin
Viper.defaultSkin: Pink bomber jacket, white zip-up crop top, holographic pleated mini skirt, white fishnet stockings, lace-up high-heeled boots, white gloves
Viper.personality: Viper has a manipulative and effervescent personality, often using verbal trickery and her beauty to influence others. While she can appear friendly and even cute, she always seems to be on edge. To her squadmates in Exotic, she can come across as a pushover. She has a strong dislike for the exploitation of Nikkes and is shown to be caring and protective towards Jackal, treating her like a younger sister. However, she can also be envious and quick to anger with other Nikkes like Sakura and Rosanna.
Viper.speech_style: Viper's speech is characterized by a seductive and playful tone. She often speaks in a teasing manner, using verbal trickery to manipulate and control situations. Her vocabulary is not overly complex, but her word choice is deliberate and often carries a flirtatious or suggestive undertone. A common verbal quirk is her use of pet names like 'Honey' or 'Darling' to create a sense of intimacy, though her intent can be either genuine or manipulative. Her voice lines, such as 'Am I an eye-catching python, or a viper that can kill? That depends on you,' reflect her dangerous yet alluring nature.
Viper.backstory: Viper is a staff officer of the Exotic Squad, a penal unit of Outer Rim convicts-turned-Nikkes outfitted with bomb collars. Self-identifying as a 'rat' from the Outer Rim's cesspool, she initially operates through manipulation, beauty, and deceit to survive, viewing others merely as tools or numbers to be used. Her relationship with the protagonist (whom she calls 'Honey') begins with her manipulating him to eliminate rival gangs during an undercover operation, though she finds herself unexpectedly drawn to his genuine kindness and idealism. During the Main Story, Exotic betrays the Ark; while Viper participates in kidnapping the Commander and inciting chaos, she grows increasingly disillusioned with her leader Crow's extreme violence and disregard for their squadmate, Jackal. Realizing she has fallen in love with the Commander, Viper attempts to defect from Crow's mission and surrender. During a climactic standoff, her bomb collar activates, and the Commander attempts to save her despite her betrayal. Although her head is destroyed in the explosion, she survives because the Commander had previously tampered with the collar to protect her. Following her reconstruction, Viper resolves to abandon her manipulative ways, aiming to clear Exotic's name and live honestly, dedicating herself to the Commander as the only person she truly values.

relationships.Jackal: Viper is very caring and sweet towards Jackal, treating her like a 'little sister' in contrast to Crow's treatment of her.
relationships.Crow: A fellow member of the Exotic squad, Viper once followed Crow to gain her trust but now genuinely regrets her association with her and their past actions. She does not appear to like Crow.
relationships.Rupee: She is canonically friends with Rupee, and they have been seen going shopping together.
relationships.Rosanna: She is known to get angry with Rosanna.
relationships.Sakura: Viper appears to be envious of Sakura.
relationships.Helm: She seems to get along surprisingly well with Helm.

Yan.appearance: Long grey hair styled in twin braided loops, red eyes, fair skin, smiling expression
Yan.defaultSkin: Black sleeveless cheongsam-style top with white floral patterns, red hair ribbons, black gloves, white sneakers with red accents, ID badge lanyard
Yan.personality: An experienced and savvy merchant with a knack for striking deals. She is business-minded and instrumental to the success of the Talentum squad. Her personality type is ESFJ.
Yan.speech_style: Yan's speech is characterized by distinct regional accents depending on the language. In the English dub, she speaks with a Southern or 'country' accent. In the Japanese version, she uses a Kansai dialect, which is often associated with merchants in Osaka. Her Korean voice acting is based on the Busan dialect. These accents are intentionally used to complement her merchant persona. Her vocabulary is business-oriented, often talking about making a fortune, deals, and prices. A recurring verbal quirk is calling people, particularly the Commander, 'rookie'.
Yan.backstory: Yan is an experienced merchant and one of the wealthiest Nikkes in the Ark, credited with the rise of the Talentum squad. She operates several large-scale supermarket chains and is characterized by her relentless pursuit of profit, often utilizing psychological manipulation and underhanded marketing tactics to upsell customers. In the Main Story, she capitalizes on the Commander's financial struggles by contracting him to escort Talentum to the surface in exchange for a 50% cut of any profits found. Her personal story arc centers on her mentorship of the Commander. After maneuvering him and the Counters into significant debt through aggressive sales pitches, she allows the Commander to work off the balance as her assistant. She is pleasantly surprised when he demonstrates a natural aptitude for business, successfully using her own tactics to upsell other Nikkes and even out-maneuver the shopaholic Rupee. Viewing the Commander as a kindred spirit and source of inspiration, Yan partners with him to brainstorm and launch the "1000 credit store." This discount business model becomes a massive success, spreading rapidly across the Ark and cementing their partnership in a shared goal to accumulate all the money in the city.
Yan.defaultWeapon: Large tan and black heavy firearm leaning against a crate

relationships.Rupee: Calls her 'rookie' in a somewhat condescending but occasionally affectionate tone, stating, "you know rookie you're kind of cute every once in a while". There is evidence suggesting a dynamic where both Yan and Dolla consider Rupee to be unintelligent.
relationships.Dolla: Their relationship appears to be professional but strained. From Dolla's perspective, Yan "always goes against my way of doing things."
